Summary: That's about as much praise as I can give it. It's a 60s style motel and they've tried to make it more appealing, but it's putting lipstick on a pig. They've put in more modern furniture, but it's still a 60s style motel.  Asked if they had a corkscrew and they said we'd have to come down and use the only one they had. Not a deal breaker, but emblematic of the place. We live here and were checking it out for future visitors. Will NOT recommend. And you want to get a western facing room otherwise the freeway will keep you up all night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we do apologize for the inconvenience.

Summary: Breakfast was great Working the front desk Gilbert and housekeeping girls Marcella & Diana were fabulous, I asked for something and they would see that I got it. Room very clean. The only disappointment was the pool was closed. But you can Uber to the beach. Which their is alot of them Aliso Beach is the closest and one of the nicer beaches.

Summary Heading: Great location for a great price
Summary: Wedding day it made it easy to make it to the gardens. Service Dog Friendly. Watch out for the coyotes they are a little scary so try to stay in the light of you must watch walk your dogs late at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and we appreciate you choosing to stay with us. We do apologize about the inconvenience for the coyotes.

Summary: Based on the 7.8 stars out of 10 on hotel.com, I expected this hotel to be a clean decent Best Western in San Juan Capistrano. The pictures of the rooms and location made it appear good. However, we were disillusioned when we arrived to our room.  First of all, you can tell that the hotel needs some renovating to be done, and the worst of it was the ant problem in the hotel. I have never experienced that at a hotel before.  I know it had been raining a lot the past week, thus the reason for the ants, but you would think the hotel would be aware and make sure that all rooms have been cleaned and sprayed for ants.  Also, there were vagrant people hanging around the hotel as well as it was obvious that the hotel rents rooms out to homeless people.  My husband walked by one of the
Manager Response: Dear Claudia Paterson,  Thank you for completing the survey regarding your recent stay at our property.  On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary Heading: Just pay a little extra to stay elsewhere.
Summary: The room was extremely noisy, the lady at the front desk could've been a little more friendly, and as many have stated you do have to pay $15 per day for parking. This hotel is borderline motel 6 charging Holliday inn prices.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Summary: Located just minutes away from downtown (easily walking distance), clean, with a helpful and friendly staff. Fantastic value for all of the above. Will definitely be staying here again next time I am in the area.

I don't write reviews often, but there are enough issues with this place that I feel should be known.  On a positive note, the staff were friendly.  But there were several negatives: 1) the floors in the rooms were absolutely filthy--our feet/socks were brown just walking across the floor.  Gross.  2) The room layout did not match pictures on the website.  It was definitely older/not as nice as the pictures, but that is not completely unexpected because it is a common practice unfortunately.  The bigger difference is that the website shows two separate vanity/mirror areas in the room we reserved, but the room had only a single sink and mirror. With four in our party, the extra sink/mirror was part of the reason we picked that room. 3) they have a $15/day parking fee that is not
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future. Our policy for the parking started March 2022. The policy was put into place to keep unauthorized vehicles off the property, guest honest from taking up several parking spaces, and upkeep/security or the parking lot. Notification were sent out February, and all platforms including ours was posted in March. We did not enforce it until May 1, 2022. All of our signage is laminated, so there are no hand written notes or signage. Lastly, the policy is on your welcome letter, reservation card you signed, and the signs posted are just a last reminder in case the policy was missed on any of the sites. We do apologize for the rest of your experience.

Summary: Very satisfied.  Filled all our requirements.  Friendly desk, very comfortable bed, good breakfast. There was a $15.00 a day parking fee, but it was waived.  Would stay there again as it was close to where we visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and we are glad you chose to stay with us. Come back and see us again.

Summary: Check in was OK very nice lady, that's where it ends.   Rooms are old and not in good condition.  Hot water does not exist.  Had to ask for more thread bare towels.  Traffic noise, sirens...and difficult getting in and out of property.       Property is not kept up, dirty hallways and around ice machine.  Housekeeping does not check to see if towels or coffee are needed along with not picking up trash.  I reported the little ants in room.  Parking on website says free parking but has a $15/day fee.  Also, I didn't get my points.
Manager Response: We do apologize for your inconvenience, however the parking fees have been on the sites since March 2022, and was enforced May 1st, 2022. We did not charge you a parking fee, it was waived. You only get points if you book directly through us, not when you book through a third party. They already give you a discount in advance.

Summary: Very expensive for what you get. Staff was not helpful with the parking situation. They charge for parking and you are allowed 1 car. We had another person meeting us there and sharing a room. They couldn't park there. It is definitely listed on their website but you'd have to dig for that information it is not clearly stated and readily visible.

You can hear traffic all night long. Only one way in or out of the property. The are some great places to eat nearby.  Las Golondrinads Mexican restaurant is a one of the great places to eat. Hot breakfast at the hotel is not bad. You do have to pay for overnight parking if you are not an elite member.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for the inconvenience and not exceeding your expectations. .

Summary: The jacuzzi was only lukewarm . . . not hot enough to be usable.  I reported it the first night.  They sent Carlos, the maintenance man.  He said he turned the heater on but only the jets started working.  It never got hot.  The next day it was still only lukewarm and still not usable. This is not up to Best Western standards and not acceptable for the room rate we paid.  Disappointing. In our room there was a sewer smell coming up from the drain in the sink.  Other than that the room was fine. The front desk staff and maids were friendly & helpful.

Charges $15.00 for parking ( not on booking rate or website. They only clean rooms 3 days a week. Pathetic management and Best Western corporate wont even call you back. Stay here, guaranteed plan on being over charged and be welcomed by all the things they dont do.
Manager Response: We do have it posted online in the Hotel Amenities section. Hotel features has our pet policy, parking policy with fee, and everything offered when you are booking. We also have it posted on all third party platforms. We sent out notifications that we were adding a parking policy March 2022. We did not enforce it until May 1st, 2022. You are welcomed to check the Best Westerns, competitors, or any location in the area, and our parking fee is the lowest price for parking. The policy was put into place to keep guest honest (not parking in multiple parking spaces), unauthorized vehicles from parking on the property, and upkeep up the parking lot. Again, we do apologize for the inconvenience. When you were checked-in, we also notified you about our housekeeping COVID PROTOCOL (servicing days Tuesday, Friday, & Saturday for cleaning). We apologize for the inconvenience and understand that we have to follow protocol.

Summary Heading: Needs remodeling, but room was very clean
Summary: The room needs updating, e.g., the molding at the bottom of the bathroom door was cracked and the furnishings were quite old.The counter and sink had been renovated. The bed was comfy and there were plenty of pillows. Although in need of renovation, my room was very clean and the rate extremely reasonable. Driveway is right off the freeway, but very poorly marked. I ended up driving around for 15 minutes trying to find the driveway. A sign at the road is needed.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback, and we apologize for the inconvenience. We do have a sign at the end of the entrance. Check back with us after the renovations.

Summary: Classic motor court hotel. Two story, no elevator. If that is a problem, request your downstairs room early.   Room had a large "mini" fridge with nice size freezer compartment and a microwave. Large vanity and sink outside of bath/toilet room. Large recliner in the room was really comfortable. Full size fiber pillows - not those kind filled with foam chunks. I had a good, restful sleep.  As of May 1, 2022, they now charge $15 per day (night) for parking a single vehicle.

Don’t stay here. What’s the difference between a motel and an inn? I’m not sure, but this was the worst place I’ve ever stayed. There were ants all over the shower, “clean” towels, and toilet paper dispenser. The room smelled of mildew and the sink faucet smelled like sewage. The mattress on the bed was the lumpiest I’ve ever slept on. It was not worth the price. Rent an Airbnb or stay somewhere else.   The only thing that was good was the staff at check in and check out was kind.

The Best Western was a solid base hit. It’s not going to knock your socks off, but at this price point it was clean and quite. The pool was surprisingly well maintained. The breakfast offering was much better than I expected.

The smell of cigarette smoke was coming into my room through the air vents and from all the rooms next to mine which it was disgusting and because of it wasn’t able to sleep well. Also, I noticed ants in the shower tube.

Our rooms were not cleaned unless we called the front desk multiple times to confirm someone was actually going to come by. We were there for 4 nights - the room was cleaned once. Towels etc. weren't stocked well and we constantly had to walk to the front lobby to get more.   Not to mention, one of the days, the cleaning staff said to leave our door open because they planned to come in and clean (we were heading out for a wedding). We confirmed *multiple* times if we should leave the door open - they confirmed each time: Yes, leave it open.   We left for the wedding at 2:45pm. We returned that evening at 9:30pm to find the door STILL open. The staff never came to clean, nor did they even bother to close the door - and when we left, we left them right *next* to the door. The
Manager Response: Thank you for completing the survey regarding your recent stay at our property.  On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future. We do apologize for the inconvenience, however the day in question was reviewed on the cameras. Who did you confirm with to leave your room open, because housekeepers have keys to enter your room? From 9:13am when a housekeeper let a woman into that particular room carrying breakfast, no one came to or left that room until the guest left the room at 10:42 am. No one stopped to ask the housekeepers if they were servicing the room, passing one (housekeeper) on the way to leaving the parking lot with family in a white mini van until returning later that evening. A manager was told on that night what had happened, however the cameras with audio told a different story. We did compensate you for the inconvenience even though there was no wrong doing on our behalf. We gave you the block pricing passed the cut off date, waived the parking fees, and discounted the room on behalf of the Hotel. We sincerely apologize for your experience and thank you for your feedback.  If I can provide any assistance, please don't hesitate to contact me directly at 9494935661.

Summary: Rooms had bugs, smelled of mold, and barely looked clean! There was a dirty rag left on the room upon arrival. Air conditioning and water pressure barely worked. The mold smell was absolutely disgusting throughout the entire visit. Ants and flies in the room. Will not be staying here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Summary: This hotel is an overpriced dump. My sink was clogged, bathtub drain broken, bathroom fan screeching, air conditioner worked but made loud noises all night long. This is an over priced property that has not been well-maintained.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Very basic hotel, not worth any rate to stay
Summary: Rooms were the worst. Tub was not somewhere you would want to take a bath, shower was quick since tub was hard to stand in.  Bed frames something I have never seen before. My reservation was for king bed got room with two beds. At check in the person behind desk seemed disinterested and not helpful at all. Had to find room by walking around, she didn’t even show me the map of the room location. This place should be torn down and rebuilt or just forget the hotel business. Have traveled extensively for business and wouldn’t leave my dog here.  This place is depressing!
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback. We apologized for the inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Good motel, but there could be better values in nearby towns.
Summary: This is an older hotel with the exterior room doors that open into the parking lot, which is fine, but just so you know. The room was comfortable, and they had a decent selection for breakfast and I had no issues while I stayed here. And the rate I was charged was reasonable for the room. However I did see a sign at the front desk that they were going to start charging a $25/night parking fee for future reservations. I don't see it listed on the Best Western web site, but I do see that one other recent reviewer mentioned that they were charged without knowing about it. This fee would definitely lower the value for the motel. And when I was looking to potentially stay here again in June, the room rates were significantly higher which were then too high for what I felt I got
Manager Response: We apologize for the inconvenience, however the parking fee policy was sent out to all platforms March 2022. We did not enforce it until May 1, 2022. The parking fee on our site is listed under hotel amenities, posted in the lobby, your reservation, welcome letter, and was $25.00. The fee is now $15.00 for parking daily. The parking fee was put into place to keep unauthorized vehicles from parking on the property, and keep guest honest parking with multiple vehicles (leaving other guest without parking.)  Even at $25.00 with our rates, we were the cheapest, and you are welcome to check the entire area.  Again, we sincerely do apologize for the inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Quick stop just off the freeway
Summary: We’ve stay here on numerous occasions. Close to everything. Rooms are always clean, check in and out easy. Great location, great food and the mission is nearby. Staff is very courteous and professional.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to any future visits.

Summary: Rented a two-bedroom room with a friend for overnight getaway. The room was plain but clean. There were scuff marks on the baseboards and the room could use a fresh coat of paint. The balcony only had one chair and no table (it would be nice to have two chairs and a table). The hotel is right next to the fwy but close to everything in the center of town. The breakfast was very good! Hot, fresh scrambled eggs, potatoes, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for your experience and will continue to get better with service. We want our guest to have the best experience possible, and is sorry for the inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Overpriced parking, read the fine print.
Summary: I don’t recall that the advertised room rate online disclosed an additional $25/night parking fee. It’s probably buried somewhere as usual in fine print, but be aware that upon check-in that the fee will be disclosed on a handwritten sign posted in their lobby just to mitigate any charges of false advertising.
Manager Response: We apologize for the inconvenience while staying at our hotel. Thank you for the feedback, and we will continue to get better with our service.

Summary: Check in was super slow and no effort was put in to engage with guests. Room had musty smell, facecloth was stuffed under a/c unit, one bed was super firm and the other was soft. Right off the freeway which is great, but the noise level from the cars was unbearable to sleep. First night, police were pulling a car over at 3am and woke up the kids.  A/C unit was very loud along with the water from the shower every time a guest in the other rooms turned it on. Breakfast was included which is always a nice feature especially with the outrageous price of the room but it was nothing to talk about. Pool closed at 9 although signs said 10. Key cards stopped working on the second day and we had to wait 20 minutes at the front desk for new key cards.  I would not recommend this hotel to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and apologize for your experience staying at our hotel. We are sorry for the inconvenience, and  will continue to get better the best experience given to our guest.

Summary: I’d do zero stars if I could. This place was super shady with their business practices. We reserved our room through a third party and the total came out to a great deal of 487 for 4 nights. We arrived and checked in and my card was charged an extra $50 and I inquired about it, she said it was for a security deposit; fine. However over the stay I noticed more charges being posted on my card. Turns out they charge $25 a day for parking— something I wasn’t informed of at check in. When asking about it to the same lady who checked me in, she acted very rudely and continued to insist she informed us about the fee. We were never informed about it when checking in from her. She had 3 people waiting behind us and was likely flustered and didn’t inform us, but that isn’t my problem.
Manager Response: We apologize for your experience. There is a standard deposit/incidental  of refundable $50.00 when staying at our hotel. We also notified each of our partners, third party sites, and on our site (Hotel amenities section) about our paid parking for $25.00 daily back in March. We did not enforce the policy until  May 1st, 2022. Again, we will continue to give our guest the best experience, and apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Summary: Friendly and helpful staff. A 10-minute walk to the Mission and a 15-minute walk to the Los Rios Historic District. The motel is located next to the freeway, which some may consider a plus and others a drawback.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here unless you are willing to spend 45 min trying to check in.
Summary: Stood in line 45 min to get checked in.  Lobby was 10 people deep and they had a young, incompetent agent trying to deal with a POS system with him on the line with the "owner/manager" trying to figure out what to do.  The "owner/manager" should have gotten in the car and driven back to the hotel and helped check people in instead of staying on the phone that long trying to walk the agent through this mess.

We decided to stay at the best Western San we came to San Juan Capistrano in to visit the mission in San Juan Capistrano great location easy to walk to very comfortable and really nice employees Hotel breakfast was excellent lots of choices fresh hot coffee nice clean rooms comfortable beds and a nice balcony

Key card reader didn’t work and was locked out of my room for 2 hours. Multiple keys made, no maintenance person there, master key didn’t work. Front desk couldn’t help and had to have the sheriffs get involved. Disappointing.

This hotel is conveniently located by the I-5 fly in San Juan Capistrano.  The checking process was impersonal and painfully slow. The King room with balcony was painfully small. It was somewhat chilly and there was no blanklet for the bed. The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of hot and cold foods from which to choose. At $163 we believe the value was just not there.

This place is great value for the money. Room was clean. No smells or stains. Check in and out was a breeze. Definitely would stay again. I just wish there was a directory to know where your room is at but still great place.

Summary Heading: Fine stay but hotel needs a makeover
Summary: We found  Capistrano Brewing, Heritage BBQ, and Dog Pawrk Brewing due to staying here but the hotel itself needs a makeover. We'd been staying in our Van at RV parks prior to our stay with our two dogs. Although we had more space to move around it hadn't been cleaned very well. It was a fine place but we've been to MANY BW hotels in the NW and this just didn't meet the experience and expectations we've come to appreciate

Summary Heading: Room was excellent; Exterior a bit tired; Green space for pet short drive away
Summary: When I first drove in, I was a bit worried because the exterior of the hotel could really use a facelift. But the room seemed to be newly refinished. It was clean and comfortable, quiet enough even if it faced the freeway. I was initially given a 2nd floor room but because my dog is arthritic, I preferred a 1st floor room. The front desk was very helpful and found me a good alternative. I give the hotel a 4 because it was difficult to find the driveway (no clear signage), the "green space" for pets is not too pleasant and the location makes it difficult to simply walk around the area. There is however, a wonderful green space a short drive away.

The Capistrano Inn was a very nice experience. We stayed 5 nights. Clean, comfortable bed, and a great full hot breakfast. The Inn is aesthetically appealing to the San Juan Capistrano area. Reasonable price for this area. Close to everything.

For the price this property should have had the pool area open. It’s not by the beach, after all. But with nothing in San Clemente it was close enough. I would suggest that they redo the outside appearance and open there pool and spa now that there’s no mask mandate in that area.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for a quick get-away
Summary: We booked this hotel because we were attending a wedding near by. We were hesitant based on a few bad Trip Advisor reviews but figured we could handle one night. Check-in is listed as 4 pm and our wedding was 4 pm. Fortunately for us, the hotel emailed us the day before our arrival to pre-register and asked us what time we would be arriving. The hotel is very easy to find, right off the freeway. We estimated 3 pm as our check-in time but as it turned out we arrived at 2:30 pm. We were warmly welcomed by the front desk clerk who checked on the status of our room. Unfortunately we were told it wouldn’t be ready for 25 minutes and we “could wait in our car”. So we walked around the property and sat in our car to wait.   Once it was 3 pm, we were able to get our room. While the

Stayed at this hotel 11/12 - 11/15.  Reserved a King Bed room and requested building three or four. We were here for a wedding and was told these were the most recently updated rooms. We had organized  the stay at this hotel with four other couples. We arrived late around six thirty pm form the Sacramento area. Checked in and was given room 101. It looked like a converted utility room and smelled of cigarette smoke. Might be the worst I have seen at any hotel.  Went to the office and asked for the King room we requested. The front desk guy argued that We had received an upgrade because it cost more and they were sold out go the King room category that we had reserved. Was told all he could do was a double in building two (214) What a dump, very run down, terrible accommodations.

It was a very run down hotel.  We were very disappointed.  We discovered we didn't have towels so when I asked at the front desk I was told they didn't have towels, we had to use bath mats to dry!  sad stay

Excellent hotel. Rooms are clean, spacious, and very comfortable. My experience at the front desk… terrible. Employee seemed bored, sleepy (kept yawning), and miserable. His unkept appearance didn’t help much either. He performed his duties but was no help in room direction or anything else. It’s a shame because everything else was excellent.

Spacious room with cute décor. The archway into the vanity gives the room a different feel than your typical motel room. The tile in the vanity room added a extra little bit of charm and hominess. The room itself was very spacious and comfy, the bed was comfortable enough.

Room was at first site nice.. we stayed 2 nights and didn’t have enough towels or toilet paper.  Found 2 small roaches in the bathroom. Reported it to front desk when we checked out and I did hear the staff call maintenance to ask to spray room.  Housekeeping did not come to room to offer services, we had to call to ask for what we needed.  I would stay again. It served it’s purpose.  Complimentary breakfast was nice.  Had multiple options

My wife and I really love staying at this hotel. Easy access from the highway and the proximity to the Mission makes it a very good way to enjoy your visit. Plus the nice way we were treated by the people at the counter is a plus.

I checked in at 1pm. It took the front desk clerk 5 times to swipe my credit card before it went through keep in mind I have a 50k card with a zero balance. The clerk seem high on a substance. After that my sons dropped the bags off in the room they came back to the car and said dad that room smells. I told them I would see when we got back because we had to go. I came back around 9pm. The room had wet towels on the floor, the beds were slept in, and the room smelled like urine. I immediately removed our luggage and ourselves and went to the front desk and reported the problem. The response I got was HERE IS YOUR BILL. Absolutely infuriating and atrocious. Why would someone spend almost $400 to stay one night in this dump and leave after only being in the room for a total 15

He was very nice, but said we should change room, since they will need to change the bed sheets.  So my wife called to change rooms.  We did get another room.  But, we did see a few ants this room, but not on the bed, so since this was our last night, we decided stay in the room.  2) The office chair was filthy.  We put a towel over the chair seat.  3) Evening shift lobby staff ( I think it was Teddy-had a beard) was very unwelcoming and very unfriendly.  We just drove 10 hours, and he made us feel unwelcome.  Also, when I went to pick up new keys, he never apologized for the inconvenience (ants).  Not sure why he works at a people intensive

Summary Heading: Better Off Sleeping in Your Car!
Summary: Front desk staff, when checking in, was not friendly or accommodating, my room smelled terrible, towels crusty, carpet filthy, furniture broken, desk surface dirty, water in shower did not drain.  Thank goodness I had a balcony - I opened the drapes and slider, including the screen door to air the room out, and sprayed perfume - to no avail!  I usually carry disinfectant wipes but had none.

I booked this room weeks ago and asked for an early check in for a wedding. I was told to call before I arrived to make sure the room was ready. I wrote notes in the booking. I called the day we were leaving and they told me it "should" be ready, but when I tried to give my info she said to just call right before we arrived.  When we arrived, they were understaffed, with a lot of people waiting to be checked in. I was told there would be a shuttle for the wedding and the man at the front desk said "I don't know anything about that." I said "well, can you tell me how you can find out" he had no clue. When we got to our room (again, I get it, it's a Best Western, not the Four Seasons), we started putting things away and when my boyfriend opened a drawer, there were empty alcohol

Summary Heading: Best value for a quick trip!
Summary: We needed one night to be near Dana Point for a whale watching early morning. Didn't want to drive all the way from Northern LA to the whales during morning traffic. Best Western SJC fit the bill. Decent price, conveniently located off the freeway, good value for the room and fabulous continental breakfast early enough in the a.m. that we could take advantage before whale watching. Hotel was cute and felt safe. Totally appreciated that the room had a microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. Many other hotels don't supply those any more. Great choice for our one night stay.

This hotel is terrible.  Yes, it's the cheapest hotel in a very expensive area but it's cheap for a reason.  The hotel is dirty, tired, and the front desk staff is unfriendly.  The front door mat was so filthy we wouldn't step on it when entering the room.  We also wouldn't walk around with our shoes off as the carpet looked gross.  We couldn't get out of our 1st or 2nd night without a penalty or we would have.  The room was completely run down in every way.   It needs a complete overhaul.  The only positives were the beds were clean and the young woman doing the laundry was very helpful.  AVOID if at all possible!

This is more like Motel 6. Front desk staff is very unfriendly and uninformative about everything. When we checked in they said they were charging $50 in case we damaged the room but we would get a refund when we checked out if no damage. Location of hotel is next to freeway so very noisy along with AC unit which keeps you awake unless you're a very sound sleeper. Rooms definitely need renovation and updated. Breakfast is ok but don't expect front desk staff to give you any info about what's available. They have a frig where they take items from but only if you know about it. The rooms certainly need updating and renovation. Bathtub coating was peeling. There was a hole in the wall behind the door entrance. Beds were clean but wouldn't walk on carpet...looks very dirty. Would

From time of booking to when we left the hotel, staff were super friendly and helpful.  If I’m in the area again, I would definitely stop by here again.  There was a good variety of breakfast snacks for the kiddos.  Something for everyone.

The pool is closed, we had no cleaning service and there is no hot breakfast. None of this is reported on their website. Its a bait and switch. You find out when you check in. Several other hotels in the area had their pool facilities open

This hotel was terrible. I wouldn't stay here ever again and don't recommend it. The rooms are dirty, dark and dingy.  They aren't cleaned well at all, there was some previous guest's left over food in the fridge.   I came home late one night and the sink in the room must've backed up while I was gone. There was thick sand in the sink and the floor was wet. The carpet was wet about three to four inches back from the tile and when I tried to blot it up with a towel, the towel was black with dirt. I let the front desk know and they said they would take care of it.  When I came back later that day, the carpet was still wet and reeked of mildew.  I was told there was nothing they could do to change my room.  I paid $225 a night for a room that was flooded and smelled terrible.

Summary Heading: Poor Customer Service at Front Desk
Summary: The Hotel Front Desk personal is extremely RUDE. The Gentleman, who was working on Sunday Morning (5-23-21), had no Customer Service and Phone Educate what so ever.  When I called and he stated Front Desk, I had ask for a name, I myself like to do business on a first name basis, when I repeatedly asked for his name again and again, He told me there was no need for me to acknowledge his name and to state my call.  The reason for my call  was, was to see if there were open days for the week in July and the location to the mission and shops.  I tried to explain and once again ask for his name, to my surprise, He hung up on me.  This person was not professional and was n no need in helping me out.  If you do not train him properly or remove him from the front desk, you will be

The guy who works on the front desk was poor customer skills. He even refused to give his name. I asked for 2 pieces of granola bars which is available during breakfast. I told him that I will be checking out very early before breakfast area is open. He refused & told me to wait until 6:30 AM. The guy who works on the front desk is rude & with poor customer service skills.

Convenient location to downtown San Juan Capistrano.  Free parking available.  Friendly staff.  Rooms were clean when we arrived; did not get room cleaning service on second night, that was a bit of a surprise.  Prepaid for rooms at reservation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of our hotel. I am glad to hear that you stay was great! Our staff strive to provide the best quality of service to all our valued guests like yourself.  During covid-19, we are providing very limited service for second day room service.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to your next stay!  Atul Kumar, General Manager

Summary: Police came to try to get someone with guns drawn twice in the room right across from us and my family and I had to shelter in place. My wife and daughter were terrified thinking bullets would soon be coming through our room. No one from the hotel or Best Western tea he’s out to us at all regarding the incident. Very traumatizing!
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and sharing your experience.  On behalf of my entire team, I apologize for falling short of your expectation.  I assure you this was never our goal and we look forward to using your feedback as a training tool for future guest interactions.  Atul Kumar, General Manager

Summary: When deciding to stay here, I chose this place because it was relatively inexpensive, close to town, and a three-star hotel. Make no mistake: this place is not a three-star hotel. If you are looking for a two-star hotel, this is a great hotel for you, but for a three-star hotel, this simply isn't comparable to another Best Western. All the rooms are accessible from outside, like a Motel 6. At night (or even during daytime), it is definitely not very safe. When reading reviews before choosing the hotel, I read a handful of reviews referring to the safety, but because it was so infrequent, I decided it couldn't be that bad. It's really not great. To get to our room, we had to go through a narrow path that was not lit AT ALL, the perfect setting for getting robbed. As for the
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and sharing your experience.  On behalf of my entire team, I apologize for falling short of your expectation.  I assure you this was never our goal and we look forward to using your feedback as a training tool for future guest interactions.  Thank you again and safe travels!

Summary Heading: Five stars Best western San Juan Capistrano Inn
Summary: This is my second week staying here while my house is being remodeled. And compared to the popular hotel I was previously staying at, I prefer BW San Juan Capistrano Inn  much more. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. It’s conveniently located near downtown and close to the freeway as well as Tesla charging stations. Tim at the front desk was very accommodating and polite when I booked my stay. Cleaning crews have also been helpful and kind. I highly recommend this motel, great stay for a good price.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations.  Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!  Atul Kumar, General Manager

Summary Heading: Disdainful and angry GM made this a truly forgettable experience.
Summary: Terrible Experience, beyond surreal that someone would act this way.  I started packing yesterday to realize that i had accidentally booked the hotel for the night before. It was an honest mistake I made with one click of the button, just the day before. So I called the hotel and explained it to them, but they told me I had to talk to Expedia. For the next two hours, I was on the phone with Expedia and the GM of this Best Western, Jay. After awhile, Expedia told me that the GM declined to accommodate me in any way. So I called the hotel back and asked to speak to the GM myself. I was transferred to someone who claimed to be the GM, but wasn't. Finally, I was forwarded to the actual GM, Jay, who was already livid before he took the call.  Jay informed me that he did not care that

Summary Heading: Good Location in San Juan Capistrano
Summary: We had a nice one-night stay here on our way from Illinois to Catalina Island.  We had hoped to see the Mission, but it was closed on Wednesdays.  Due to COVID-19, some things were a bit different.  The complimentary breakfast was a box lunch, and there was no place to sit and eat.  It would have been nice if there was a picnic table outside the lobby.  I think that that will be fixed is they get their swimming pool open and it will be possible to sit by the pool.

This is a nice, pet friendly hotel that is very convenient in San Juan Capistrano. Right on I-5 , but from our room we could hear no noise at all. The room was clean and fresh, the staff was friendly and the hotel was overall great.

Summary Heading: Old hotel but clean and comfortable, great location
Summary: Friendly front desk staff. I had a nice stay despite the Covid19 deal. Clean comfortable room but older.  The property and pool area looked nice but everything was closed due to the situation.  They did their best despite the conditions.  Recommended !!

The worse experience ever. My girl friend and I are regulars at this facility since I live away from this area and we had stay at this hotel several times. however, about two weeks ago we had the worse experience ever. we were having some wine and when my girl friend was having her drink she swallowed a roach into her mouth. fortunately she felt it and was able to spite out. but it was so discussing and embarrassing for me to see that. I was very upset and tried to call the office at that moment but my girl friend calmed me down. she did not even wanted for me ask for an other room. when we turn all the lights on we discover several roaches on the chest drawer in the mile of the two beds. there were also some on desk to the left of the TV. and we even found some baby ones in the

The outside isn't impressive but inside the room is nice. It was very clean and in good working order. The hot tub was quite small but nice and warm. The breakfast is your typical Best Western spread which is good. The location is great as there are quite a few dining options nearby and the Mission was close.

Well, the grounds where our room were in, anyway; which is on the 2nd floor, the farthest to the left.  There were birds of paradise, and there were rain the night before when we stayed, so the coast was foggy from it.  It made for a very rainforest-y hotel because of the landscaping our room was situated next to.    There's free breakfast, and free parking which is good.  The room is a bit old, but I never felt unsafe.  We're staying for the night since we work nearby and had to stay for the night because our house is an hour's away from here, and my spouse had very little sleep, so it's a convenience thing.  The front desk had no personality, but he's fairly young, maybe 19.  Granted, there's very little to do with regards to checking in, since everything was already done

Summary Heading: I found a bottle of lube behind my bed
Summary: The hotel reminded me of a travel lodge, and on my last day (I had already been sleeping there for 2 nights), I found a bottle of lube shoved behind the bed. I sure hope the sheets actually got cleaned.

Summary Heading: Great location for San Juan mission, Dana Point
Summary: Excellent location, great breakfast for children, great clean pool and excellent rooms.  I would highly recommend the location and the value for money offered by this best western in San Clemente.  Staff were wonderful

Summary Heading: Needs upgrades in alot of places
Summary: Toilet was making a very loud whistling noise everytime we flushed, and we had a very bad night sleep. They fixed the problem, by replacing toilet, but no apology and nothing else was said or done about it.

We just stayed here and we were very happy with this hotel. Room was very clean and spacious. Excellent housekeeping and staff! Definitely recommend this establishment. Good location close to many historical sites to visit.

Summary Heading: 6:30 am breakfast too late for working people
Summary: Overall the hotel is fantastic from service to cleanliness. However they do not accommodate the multiple construction workers that stay at their hotel probably have to occupancy according to the vehicles in the parking lot. Most job sites open at 7 a.m. and they do not start serving breakfast till 6:30 a.m. it gives you no time to drive to the job and have breakfast at the same time. It would be fantastic if all Best Westerns started their breakfast at 5:30 a.m. in the morning for their construction working followers

Long story short, we had construction issues, were not told at check in, and never got a call back from the manager for 3 days we were there. They are not willing to do anything about our issues. Will NEVER stay nor let anyone I know stay there.

I highly recommend for both the business and leisure traveler.  Friendly staff. Great clean rooms!  I had a quick turnaround one night stay...which I do on a monthly basis in San Juan Capistrano.  I have stayed at other venues for this but from now on I will stay here.

The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  Great dining recommendations. Room was clean and decorated nicely.  I would recommend that the exterior be cleaned up and free of unnecessary equipment. The breakfast was good however there needs to be more toasters and waffle makers as their was a great deal of back up due to the number of guests.

The staff was professional and helpful. The room was very clean, with a comfortable bed and good shower.  Our room had a refrigerator and microwave.  The internet worked well and the breakfast was great. I would stay here again.

Great value location. Walking distance to the Mission. Clean rooms and great staff. Breakfast had a lot of variety. Nice restaurants less than two blocks away. The beach is a 15 minute drive away. Really good jumping off point for a vacation.

This Best Western has great rooms.  They are super comfortable and feel elegant.  The bathrooms are average but fine.  Breakfast was really decent with a good variety.  The area is really quite and peaceful, especially for being in the middle of busyness and the freeway.

Summary Heading: Older Property in need of some Helpful People at the Front Desk
Summary: As travelers, we all know that people can make or break an experience. In our case, we booked for overnight as we were attending a wedding in the area and this was one of the designated hotels. My reservation request included early access to our room since the wedding was at 2 pm and we were traveling by car from 3 hours away. I called the day before to check and the front desk person was not helpful at all. She suggested I give them a call around 2 pm the next day to see if a room was available. I explained to her again, that the wedding was starting at 2 pm. It just was not registering. Knowing we had a problem, we arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am. Guess who was the only one working the front desk, yes, the same gal from the phone call the day before. She kept saying they were

Location was great for activities in Dana Point. I can be hard to get our of the hotel during high traffic times as it's almost impossible to go towards town - have to go right and make a couple U-turns. Room and grounds were nice other than smelly food we found in our fridge when we went to use it.

Great value. Very clean, well landscaped, comfortable lodge. Lovely pool and hot tub area. We particularly appreciated being given a ‘mobility room’ with grab bars in the shower and toilet area.  It’s not a fully loaded room for disabled. Just modified a bit. We will ask for this again. Wonderfully helpful and pleasant staff.

2 days in October.  Room very clean and modern.  Excellent breakfast included.  Nice heated outdoor pool and hot tub.  My wife and I enjoyed our stay.  The only problem we had was loss of Internet on several occasions.  After a short delay we could get it back if I rebooted which was fine but a little annoying.

Summary Heading: Best western Capistrano inn excellent stay
Summary: Great stay at the best western. We were there for a concert at  the coach house concert hall. Great location for this event. Would differently stay here again nice clean room, plenty of free parking. Friendly & helpful staff

Got here really early as only an hour away from previous hotel.  Checked with clerk at reception and they were happy for us to leave car until 3pm check in while we walked around the historic Old Town.  A bit better signage needed from the road as although  can see sign from freeway, hard to see travelling on the 74 on left side of road. Very pleasant young male check in clerk and given room away from busy freeway as requested.  Also surprised to see we had a balcony but for some reason it proved rather smelly sitting out there in the afternoon heat but smelt wonderful in the early morning air.  Very hot so had a swim but surprised that pool seemed unheated so a bit of a shock to the system although refreshing in the heat of the day.  All the grounds seemed to be very well kept.

Summary Heading: Great location in San Juan Capistrano
Summary: Perfect home base for sightseeing, wine tasting and mission touring in the area. So you are not overlooking the ocean but it’s easy to drive to the area beaches, walkable to old town and even though it’s Near the I-5 exit, you do not get freeway noise. It’s tucked away and feels private and quiet. The breakfast is the most amazing free breakfast ever and perfect for the family. The pool is saltwater and the staff are friendly.

Summary Heading: Good overnight place to see the area
Summary: We stayed here after a family celebration. It was a very convenient location right off the highway. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. It is a little dated looking. It was quiet even though it was near a highway. The breakfast was great and included a lot. The staff were helpful and anxious to get anything that needed to be refilled or added to. Easy place to stay to see the area. There are many nearby places to eat and shop. It is a good value.

Stayed there for our 40th high school reunion. Beds were comfortable and they had a nice breakfast. It was close to the El Adobe with in walking distance and close to the beach. I would recommend it to anyone staying in the San Juan Capistrano area.

Summary Heading: Good for our one night stay
Summary: For our one-night stay, the room was good for what we needed.  Rooms are a little dated but clean. Rooms open out to external hallways.  A couple other guests staying there were loitering around outside their rooms in the parking lot which made us, with our young daughter, feel a bit uncomfortable.  Would have been nice to see some security guard walking around.  We loved the complimentary breakfast. The only problem was some of the other guests again. My husband headed down to the dining room first, relatively early. He came back saying the room was completely full, with hardly any food left. The guests were rowdy and a bit rough around the edges, to put it mildly. By the time my daughter and I went down to the dining room, those guests had left.  The woman in charge of the

Summary Heading: The best thing about this hotel was the room
Summary: I ordered a rollaway bed in advance it was not available when I checked in. The coffee maker in the room was broken I tried to callThe front desk three times that morning no answer. The breakfast area was another issue when we got there the large coffee pot was empty the hot food trays or empty had to wait 20 minutes for the refills.

Summary Heading: Unexpected charges on my credit card
Summary: When checking in, I was told there would be a $50 hold for cleaning or damage. When I checked out, there were no additional charges and they told me there was nothing to sign or any final receipt (I'd prepayed for the room). Shortly thereafter, a $50 charge posted to my credit card. When I called the hotel about it, they assured me it was a mistake that had already been corrected. 10 days later and the charge is still there! Now I'm in a dispute with my credit card company over this. Definitely watch your statement for shady charges if you stay here.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your recent stay with us did not exceed your expectations. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to make improvements to offer guests a better experience in the future. We hope you will give us another chance and stay with us again. -Best Western Hotels & Resorts

Summary: Outside is not much to look at but rooms was decent. Hotel is dated but clean. Rooms was big enough for my party of 4 without feeling like we were on top of each other. Toilet clogged 1st day. Maintenance handled right away, no problems after that. My kids enjoyed the hot breakfast. Great options with plenty of seating. Located right off hwy with food options near by.

Although this is an older property, it is apparent that the manager/owner take pride in this hotel. Our room was extremely clean even the corners of the bathroom and baseboards. Our hotel neighbor caused a bit of a ruckus on the patio and the manager was quick to rectify the situation and “relocate” them. The heated pool was great and the patio chairs and tables had umbrellas between them for shade  . We didn’t use the very small jacuzzi. We guess it would only accommodate 3 or 4 people. The breakfast was pretty standard with make your own waffles, eggs, bacon and potatoes. We would stay there again.

love San Juan Capistrano and the Best Western was conveniently close to everything, clean, friendly staff and would plan to stay again in the future.  Would recommend all to stay when they have the chance oh and breakfast which they include is great, something for everyone

Summary Heading: My New Hotel when in Orange County
Summary: Excellent experience.  I've been staying at other hotels the past couple of years and was never satisfied until finding the Best Western.   Excellent Location. Close to the freeway without the freeway noise.  I enjoyed my stay very much especially since it is Pet Friendly.   I always travel with my dogs.

Had to move rooms at 10:30pm with 2 small kids. I waited 2 days for a manager to call me, they never did, so I called to complain, the next day a front desk person called me and offered me $14 OFF THAT NIGHTS STAY! LOL, what an absolute joke! To date no one has called to rectify this further.

We love this place, it is our home away from home.  The staff members are amazing and helpful, the rooms are fresh and clean and the breakfast is yummy.  The beds are so comfortable, the Wi-Fi, etc....excellent.

Summary Heading: Quick stop between LAX and La Jolla.
Summary: The people were kind and welcoming. The room was what our family of 5 needed. The breakfast options were typical of a continental hot breakfast. My kids favorite choice was the cool whip on their waffles.

The receptionist was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. The room had a refrigerator and microwave. The breakfast was amazing like eating at a restaurant. The hostess was courteous and welcoming. Check out was easy and quick. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and location.

My family and I had a great stay!  It was wonderful to have a hot breakfast every morning and a heated pool and hot tub after a long day of walking and exploring the town.  The room was spacious and spotless.   Highly recommend.

Friendly staff. Easy check-in. Clean room. They have good service down. The breakfast is good for the price of free. Full continental with a few hot food items tossed in (eggs, potatoes, meat product). Walking distance to Mission San Juan Capistrano and the Historic Downtown District if you don't mind walking along the busy Ortega Highway.

Summary Heading: Love it when the tub leaks
Summary: The property was very nice when I arrived. Checked in around midnight. Once we got to the room i noticed dirty towels and pillow covers. I took a short shower and went to sleep. The next morning the bathroom floor was covered in water... Gross!

I am a local San Juan Capistrano resident, and needed a hotel for 2 days because my house was being fumigated. I called to make a reservation, and upon first impression I was greeted and efficiently booked immediately. Upon arrival, Mia checked us in. She was amazing! Her customer service exceeded all my expectations! The room we were given was clean, and had everything we needed. The pool area was beautiful! Nader was so accommodating and helped my friend and I with a shuttle. I highly recommend this Best Western, and I will definitely have friends and family that visit stay here.

Great place to stay, easy to walk to everything, Starbucks 1 block one way, All the other shopping, restaurants, bars the other. Keifer Sutherland even stayed there. Very clean and comfortable. Great breakfast buffet with anything you want. Would definately stay there again and again. Pool was very nice to. Manager super nice and staff.

I checked in after midnight and the front desk was friendly and quick. After a long day of traveling, that is appreciated. The rooms have an outside entrance/ motel style. It is a U shaped parking lot/hotel and was on the smaller side, so rather quiet. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. Mini fridge was cold. Breakfast was provided but I did not check it out. They have an outdoor pool but there is no gym. Free wifi was fast.  This hotel is literally along the highway but I didn't notice a lot of noise. Getting in and out of the parkng lot can be tricky because the hotel entrance is directly next to the freeway exit.  Would not want a new driver practicing their skills there.  This hotel is an easy 10 minutes from the Dana Point beaches and 5 minutes to the closest Starbucks,

Summary Heading: If you are used in the Marriott stay there, do not stay at the Best Western
Summary: Just got home today 3/18/19, and I will explain why you should stay elsewhere. Number one we were given two room keys and neither one worked we had to go all the way back to the front desk and get two new room keys, Number two when we got into the room we turn the TV on and it did not work we had to wait for maintenance to come and tell us that this was an old TV and that they had to switch out controls the maintenance man was there for 20 minutes. Number three we decide to go to the pool the heated pool mind you, which is not heated we cannot go in because it is too cold so we decide to use the Jacuzzi which is the size of your tub at home, your tub is probably bigger. The next morning we go for breakfast and there are no fresh eggs bacon or Coldwater. I asked for ice and was
Manager Response: We value and encourage feedback as we use it to better serve our next guest. We are disappointed we could not provide the service and accommodations we strive to and are known for and for. We apologize for any inconvenience you encountered. Our heated outdoor pool is set at 78 degrees year round and the hotels Jacuzzi has a capacity of 6 people with online photos. The property's two ice machines are working great and the hotel lobby's gift shop is fully stocked with 30+ items! We have staffing and resources in place to rectify any issue that may arise and we desire to be informed immediately so we can rectify and provide our guests with great service. Again we are disappointed we could not meet your expectations and for your inconvenience. We appreciate your business. Thank you.

Summary: When we arrived, the clerk checking us in was very kind, informative and even offered us a restaurant in town that we were looking for and the ease of location of where we were in order to get there.  He was very clear in all information presented, then surprised us with a free continental breakfast offered in the morning.  We didn't make it because we are not morning people, but I heard from another guest that it was an awesome spread.  The room was VERY clean, great location for what we were doing that night and again, all the staff were very nice.  The bed was SO comfortable, linens were awesome.  A bit noisy in the morning with everyone dragging their suitcases along the tile pathway, but overall a great experience.

Summary Heading: Great place to stop for a visit to the Mission
Summary: Very confortable room and bed. We were given a room on 2d floor and We Hadrien a view on mountains. Ask for a room on the back ( front is on the highway)  Great breakfast in a huge place! And a warm and professionnal welcome and check-in

The rooms are clean. The staff is  friendly .  Good location you can walk to restaurants stores and even to the mission site.  Right off major roads.  Also a decent price.  These reviews want you to say too much.  Less is more.

Summary Heading: Great location spacious breakfast area great value
Summary: The location of this motel worked for us as we visited the  Mission and the El Rios section of town. Our room was on the first floor and readily accessible. The room was not brand new but it was clean and comfortable. Nice foliage right outside. We had a relaxing breakfast both mornings. The staff was pleasant,

The room was smaller than I expected, but clean. I stayed two nights and there was no housekeeping during my stay. I didn't need any additional towels but I was surprised when I arrived back at the room for the second night that it was not freshly cleaned. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The location felt safe and was close to the conference I was attending as well as the Mission and lots of dining choices. I would stay here again.

Excellent value for your money. Easy freeway access but quiet. Staff is very friendly, property is inviting. Rates very reasonable if there's not a big event on. Such a comfy bed!Will be back to stay!

My favorite hotel in South Orange County, CA.  Check in is always fast and pleasant.  The breakfast is awesome.  The grounds are well kept and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  Plenty of parking and the location is wonderful.  Will definitely be back.

Stayed here for 2 nights, on trip to visit friends who live in the area. Staff was very courteous, and the parking easy.  Rooms were a little dated, but clean and comfortable. Only issue was that the room walls allow too much conversation from adjacent room to be heard when trying to sleep - folks next door talked all night long, and we were therefore awake most of the night, too.  However, we asked to be moved to another room, and we were immediately accommodated, and the second night was far more restful!  Free breakfast in a large space, but the selections a little skimpy, and no tops for the 'to go' coffee provided, which was an omission. Good location off the I-5 freeway, and walking distance to the mission and old town area. Overall, a good choice.

Just off the freeway. Clean and cozy office and breakfast area. Got an upgrade which was a nice treat. Room was clean, bathroom spacious and newer looking. Bed was on double spring mattress so it was high off the ground - which was cozy too. Plenty dark for a good sleep.

Summary Heading: BW Capistrano Inn a great choice
Summary: Located a hop, skip and a jump from the SJC Mission, this property was a great place to "nest" for the night! With very nice rooms, personable staff and complimentary breakfast, the Best Western Capistrano Inn makes it a no-brainer to return like the swallows in March!

Visiting family. Great location. Nice exterior. Friendly staff. Great breakfast for a Best Western. Great value for the area. A short drive to all the sites in San Juan Capistrano. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Quality at a Great Price
Summary: This little hotel surprised me.  The reception area was clean and the workers were friendly.  The pool & hot tub were clean and well maintained.  The room had a great view and was very spacious and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Best Value in San Juan Capistrano
Summary: The Best Western in San Juan Capistrano is by far the best value I have found on my numerous trips home for the holidays.  The rooms are very comfortable and the conference/breakfast buffet is hands down hard to beat.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Our friends joined us for an overnight stay in San Juan Capistrano for s golf outing. The Best Western San Juan Capistrano was our choice for our hotel. The front desk personnel were efficient and professional. Our room was clean and tidy. The breakfast the next morning was the highlight. A large dining room with various table options, delicious food, especially the waffles, and a lovely host. The surprise came on check out when we were offered a snack bag to go including a water bottle, apple and granola bar, truly a nice parting gift for a freeway traveler! I would be happy to stop here again.

We like to stay here when we go to see concerts at the San Juan Capistrano coach house.  Nothing special about this place but close to the venue, it is clean and has a nice staff. The also have free breakfast and a pool.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed the hotel and local area
Summary: My husband and I visited San Juan Capistrano with our daughter for 3 nights and loved the convenient of the hotel to downtown! The hotel was very clean and well maintained. We ate the complimentary breakfast each morning and liked the different options. The price we paid for the room was lower then the near by hotels I saw online. Overall it was a great time and we will definitely return to this location.

Room had roaches and unpleasant odor.  Used air freshener frequently.  We selected this hotel for it's proximity to a wedding venue and stayed for 5 nights.  The breakfast service was adequate and the server was friendly and hard working.  We spent as little time at the hotel as possible because of the issues in sentence one.
Manager Response: We appreciate the time taken to share your experience. We actively encourage and request guest feedback and use it to better serve our next guest. We want to apologize for any inconvenience and we are disappointed we did not provide the service and accommodations we strive to and are known for. Now that the potential issue is mentioned we will investigate the review and take any necessary actions. We strongly desire to be informed of any guest issue immediately as hotel has policies and procedures in place to rectify. We would love to open a dialog with you directly to eliminate any indifference, Sincerely

Summary Heading: Location, accessibility,  it has it all!!
Summary: Close to shopping  and services, sightseeing, Restaurants  and all.The pool area was relaxing as was the breakfast .  Not too crazy about the eggs...round, patty like. Don't  taste all that great!!!Need more herbal tea selection.   Also, no tea in room. Coffee only.

The pictures on the website don’t show the exterior of the building for a reason. It’s a hotel with doors facing out. I stayed on the first floor & the blinds didn’t completely close...I used a hair binder so people couldn’t see in. The walls are thin & with it being right off the highway it’s very loud. Wouldn’t recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time taken to share your recent experience. We apologize for any inconvenience your encountered. We are disappointed we could not provide you the service or accommodations we strive to and are known for. We hope you would reach out to us directly if we can be of any assistance in the future. We appreciate your business and feedback and will use this it to better serve our next guest.  Sincerely

Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Capistrano Inn for a weekend getaway.  The hotel was fine and served our needs for a short stay.  Our room was clean, and it appeared that portions of it had been updated fairly recently.  Aesthetically, the toilet/tub area could use some refurbishment. The complimentary breakfast was a plus.  It offered the usual breakfast fare and was good in quality and quantity.  The grounds are much smaller than what I envisioned from the pictures on the internet.  The only negative for us was that parking was a little cramped and upon returning one evening, every spot in the complex was taken.  The hotel clerk was kind enough to move his own vehicle and give us his spot.  The hotel is literally right off of the freeway and one side of it is adjacent to the

took several rooms for two nights for a nearby wedding. Overall room amenities, cleanliness and friendliness of staff greatly exceeded expectations. Breakfast was included, which was an unexpected plus. Only negative is strong freeway noise from West facing rooms. I strongly recommend this hotel for short stays for business or leisure in this area.

If you are a budget traveler and have appropriate expectations, you will probably be happy with this property. The rooms are spacious, ours even had a sitting area with sofa. There were windows on both sides of the room letting in lots of light, although only one window could be opened. It would have been wonderful if I could have opened both to get a cross-breeze. There are nice room amenities such as single serve coffee maker, free water bottles at check-in, and shampoo/soaps with Argan Oil. Breakfast has a good variety including hot items. The "egg rounds" were questionable and potatoes were dry so we were happier the second day with the waffle maker. The breakfast room attendant was lovely; she checked in with us both days to make sure we were happy with our food. The room

Cockroaches in the room and terrible Manager, Rob.    This was my third stay here.  The other two times were great!  This time was a different story.    The first night there, I found cockroaches on my bed and bed stand where the reading light was on.  I switched sides. The next day, I told the front desk ( a nice girl) and she suggested that I switch rooms.  I already had my room set up with my computer, unpacked etc so I told them the bugs don't really bother me (I'm from Florida), and with that light off, they seemed to go away.  She was helpful.  The following day I had late afternoon meetings, so while my room was being cleaned, I thought I would read my book by the pool. Being in hospitality gives us opportunities day in and day out to care and love on people and I personally chose this field of work for this reason. Having chances to resolve an issue and eliminate indifference will always be a top priority of ours. It can be unfortunate in this day of age when "truth" is diluted by opinions, feelings, expectations and lies.  My encounter with you was sincere and apologetic. When people are approached with aggression and words like  "WTF" it typically reduces the probability of a successful encounter. When you informed the desk staff about bugs in your room we immediately asked if we could move you rooms as we need to investigate the claim and as you stated you said no. When maintenance on the pool began no guest were present and it was always our intention to stop maintenance if a guest wanted to use the facilities as it was not major but minor. I am please you experienced many of the kind people and caring hearts that are employed at our property (I hired them). We reduced your room charges as seen on your receipt for any inconvenience. We apologize once again and appreciate your business.

Summary: This is a great place to be if you have a pet. You do not feel that your pets are an inconvenience. That is a great feeling to have.  You have to be careful going in and out of the property as it is off or Ortega Hwy. Very busy at times. Enough restaurants near by. The first couple of times we stayed was great . The last time there was a little disappointment. Broken glass by the dumpster and people tend to think the dog area is a place to dump trash and or a car battery . I feel as the grounds should be walked through on a daily basis. No reason for broken glass to stay on the parking grounds for at least the 5 days we were there. But I would go back because we have dogs and it is perfect for that!

This hotel is a great location for walking to restaurants and the Mission....The breakfast is pretty good and the pool and grounds are very well kept.....It’s right near the exit to the 5 North to go to LA

Summary Heading: Horrible stay - will never book this motel again
Summary: When we arrived to check in we were told our room wasn't ready could we return in about an hour. We did. When we came back they had given our room away and then they gave us another room with two double beds (we had reserved and paid for two queens). The girl at the desk then asked for a credit card to charge a $50 "incidentals" charge, instead she charged my card $449.00 (which was the 2-day room charge plus the $40 incidentals) so they charged me TWICE for the room. Then we get to the room and the TV isn't working and there is no one on the property to help repair it because it's 5:05 pm!!! Go figure, no help after 5:00 p.m.!!! They then sent another gal from the front desk to our room to "fix" the TV. She got a signal and said she would talk to her manager about the room rate
Manager Response: We appreciate all feedback and your business. We will share feedback to all staff as it is a great tool to better server our next guest. We apologize for any inconvenience you encountered during your stay with us. We did check you into room 220 that had 2 queen beds then you let us know that you needed a downstairs room and due to hotel availability at the time the only two bedded rooms downstairs we had were "double full beds". The authorization at check in was correct for the 2 night stay + the $50 hold for incidentals that is released at check out. We are happy someone came up quickly to correct the TV issue. Unfortunately we are unable to adjust third-party reservations. We must follow their guidelines and have the guest reach out to them directly to process any adjustments. We are disappointed we failed to provide the service and accommodations we strive to. I hope you would reach out to myself directly as we desire to eliminate any indifference and resolve any outstanding issue. Thank you.

Summary: Great hotel will definitely stay again staff was exceptional very professional friendly and rooms very clean all areas of the hotel clean.  Breakfast was great many choices will definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed a full breakfast with many options both hot and cold as well as beverages. The waffles even came with whip cream! The dining room by the pool is spacious, user friendly, and well attended by staff.

Very nice. Clean and affordable stay close to everything have been staying at hyattsville for past 15 years and prices points system has gone up with no added value to go along with it. Switching to the best Western group

Stayed here for our Anniversary. Really liked our room with the balcony. The staff was very helpful.Pool and Hot tub area was Clean and Breakfast Buffet couldn't be better for the Price Not 5 stars but that's only for $500 hotels. Thanks for all the help front desk.

We stayed at this hotel for about two weeks while house hunting. The staff is wonderful, especially Patty who handles the breakfast room daily. She does an excellent job of making sure everything is clean and constantly re- stocked.

...would be more fitting. The staff are universally pleasant and the hotel is in the lovely city of San Juan Capistrano but that’s about it as far as the positives can go. Beyond that...it’s not terrible, just far from good. It’s reasonably close in terms of access to the more historic areas of San Juan but to walk there you have to cross a six lane highway, negotiate the pedestrian crossing of entrance to and exit from the Freeway and cross about five other roads too. The facilities are acceptable but breakfast is poor with atrocious coffee that they repeatedly ran out of and a shortage of tables that was just beyond belief. How hard can it be to work out the equation between the number of potential guests and the number of seats/tables required? Will we visit SJC again?
Manager Response: We appreciate and value your time taken to share your experience of the BW Capistrano Inn. Our convenient location to the beautiful and historical mission of San Juan Capistrano and near by Orange County beaches brings visitors year-round. Our welcoming staff and friendly service will continue to meet our guest lodging needs and make guests feel cared for. We are disappointed you did not enjoy the full hot complimentary breakfast served. Our 1000 sq foot breakfast center is one of the largest areas in all Best Western properties. We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay and we hope you would reach out if we can be of any future assistance. We appreciate your business and feedback and will use and share this to better serve our next guest!

Summary: I had booked and prepaid for a room over a month in advance using another hotel search website. When we arrived and pulled up to the office, there was  a dead rat in the driveway. I go to the front desk and a young woman with long, reddish hair asked for my name and then nonchalantly tells me that room isn't available. There was no apology. I showed her my confirmation and she said they only had a handicapped room for us with one bed, when I'd paid for a room with two beds. She said they were fully booked. She didn't try to offer me anything like adding a rollaway bed for my son, or try to help. She even tried to insinuate that it was my mistake and asked me a few times, are you sure you didn't ask for a handicapped room? YES, no one is handicapped, we just needed two beds.   So
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We would like to apologize for any inconvenience you experienced that was caused by the hotel directly. Unfortunately we occasionally will see a reservation come through from that may not match what a guest believed they were booking, We will always do our very best to accommodate guest requests and make on the spot modifications. We are known for our guest room cleanliness and friendly customer service and I apologize again if you did not receive this service. We would love to open a dialog with you and eliminate any indifference, Please feel free to reach out to myself at your convenience. Thank you.

Summary: The town of San Juan Capistrano is blessed with a historic site worth visiting and a great assortment of cafes and restaurants, but the one thing it lacks is lodging close to the center of things. Not even a single B&B you’d expect in a tourist town. This need is scheduled to be filled when a new hotel is finished in 2019. But for now your best bet is the Best Western. Not that this is a hardship. The BW Capistrano is comfortable, well-maintained and scrupulously clean. The free breakfast is exactly what you’d expect from a chain lodging, or even perhaps a little more varied. The location is convenient to the Mission San Juan Capistrano, even if it isn’t scenic. No complaints from us. All we wanted was clean, comfortable and convenient and we got all three. A pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Great View from a Ground Floor Room with our Dog
Summary: This is a great location near downtown San Juan Capistrano, an easy walk.  We travel with our senior dog & she does not like elevators & cannot go down stairs so our only option is a first floor room.  Due to the topography of the site, some of the ground floor rooms have a balcony off the back of the room.  Our room had a nice view & Toffee loved laying on the balcony.  If management were to  make one improvement, it would be to have a second point of access to the dog area & maybe clean it up a bit.  Other than that, this is a perfect location & great property.

I booked Best Western due to great rates -- last minute decision to get out of town for Memorial Day Weekend.  I was shopping around for the best fare.  Best Western was the best rate and the fee included parking and breakfast. We also got a AAA discount.  I traveled with my toddler, so my priorities were safe and clean environment.  At this phase, I did not need a gym, bar...etc.  The hotel staff was very  friendly and professional.  The premises was very clean.  Room was comfortable, cozy, and clean. Two queen beds. We had a coffee maker in the room and a refrigerator/microwave (we did not use, but nice that it is available).  There is a on-site pool.  Breakfast was surprisingly varied in selection and good.  Served in the pool house until 10 a.m.  Items included:  mini egg
Manager Response: We want to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience of your recent stay with us. We love welcoming our guests and we will continue to strive to meet and exceed guest expectations. We are pleased you had a chance to encounter our friendly staff members and that you enjoyed the fruit of our labor. We are also happy you mentioned and enjoyed the hotels convenient location to the historical district and that you noticed some of the complimentary amenities offered. We pride ourselves in "Value!" We hope you would reach out to us if we can do anything for you in the future, Thank you.

Summary: Clean Rooms.  Great Breakfast.  Helpful Staff.    Good Value.  Close to venue.  Has shuttle service but drop off was not close to event site.  However, this is not a problem as local services were available during our stay.
