I stayed at this hotel back 10 years ago and it was nice then. Love how they modernized the rooms and added the flat screens. Great staff, room was clean, and hotel was nice and quiet. Comfortable beds and best of all was the complimentary breakfast. Food was fantastic, probably the best breakfast I've ever had at a hotel. Sausage was good quality, waffles were made for you, and they included 3 different fruit jams to go with it. Various yogurts were in the fridge, and they had various fountain juices as well. Great hotel, amazing value, would definitely stay again!

Had a good time and this best western made it more special. Accommodations were great. Clean rooms, friendly staff and  great breakfast. We will stay again when we are in the area and will refer family and friends.

This place is amazing, one of the best BWs around!  The pool is actually heated, jacuzzi adjacent, grounds are tidy and spacious (parking right at your door), the breakfast is super and the space enormous (no colliding into your fellow travelers going for waffles) -- and special thanks to John for getting us so fast on arrival, it was most appreciated.  No wonder we love the BW Rewards program!

The motel is a very attractive property, in an excellent location. It is located very close to many restaurants and shopping. There was ample parking and access both in and out of the property was easy.

Fabulous atmosphere with accommodating staff and clean rooms. They are friendly and welcoming. Here is the best fact:The beautiful pool is extraordinary and so well maintained. Have visited this place many times and look forward to the next one.

This is for now the only choice in San Juan Capistrano. Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Nice clean rooms. The breakfast was very good with a wide selection of food, including some hot food items. Over all we had a pleasant one night stay. The only problem was no hot water. Hotel is about .5 miles from the center of the main tourist area and the San Juan Capistrano Mission.

Summary Heading: Nice place...is it worth the price?
Summary: It's in a super convenient location, right off the interstate, which makes it a bit loud if you're on the wrong side.  Extremely clean and has a fridge and microwave to help you save on eating out while traveling. A bit expensive for me, but I did sleep like a baby.

The hotel was very nice. Breakfast was in a nice big room. It was spread out so you didn't have to wait in line. It was good. The staff in the lobby were very helpful. Amber C always had a smile and was always willing to help. Shuttle into town was great.

Summary Heading: pleasant stay close to San Juan Capistrano Mission
Summary: Nice hotel with all the amenities needed for an easy stay. Clean rooms with micro and fridge. Clean pool and hot tub. Included hot breakfast in a spacious dining room. Convenient location 1 block off interstate and just a few blocks to the Mission and numerous restaurants. A short drive to some nice beaches. Hotels are generally expensive in this area. Got a small discount through an internet discounter.

the staff was friendly,helpful and check in was easy and quick! A comfortable bed,and air conditioned room as well as wi-fi and a wide range of channells on the nice flat screen TV was so much better than I find advertised in other places I have stayed. The breakfast room was well stocked and choices were good.Hot and cold.

The staff were so helpful.  When I went to check in, I was early and they gave me a room which the maintenance dept. was painting.  The young woman who assisted me immediately straightened it out and gave me another room.  When I returned later in the evening, I could not figure out how to lock the sliding door to the veranda.  A different young woman in the office came to show me how to work it. Unfortunately it was broken.  She immediately made arrangements to move me to a room with a working lock and even helped me move my belongings to the new room. Very professional.

Summary Heading: Best Western Inn, San Juan Capistrano, California
Summary: Not what I have come to expect from a Best Western property. Room quality poor due to age of facility. Coffee pot not plugged in and plugin located behind large dresser. Maid quality sub-standard (1 towel left for 2 people). No hot water for showers, just like warm.

Overall the hotel was very clean, comfortable, good food choices for breakfast, quiet, great location for highways and restaurants in the area.  Cedar Creek restaurant was exceptional and it's location just across Highway 5. Staff were very accommodating, pleasant, courteous, just an overall great experience. I would stay there again and highly recommend.

Our family stayed here and between our four groups we each had problems.   Your lucky if you get hot water.  Electric plugs may not work.  The cleaning staff may throw away items you leave them out and they may take a break in your room while cleaning (saw one cleaner sitting on the bed and watching tv).  This might explain the long wait to check in because our room wasn't ready.
Manager Response: We are disappointed to hear of your experience. We appreciate it when as guest will inform us while in house of any issue they may be experiencing. We value that opportunities to rectify any situation that may arise during a guests stay. We are unsure by your review if the electrical outlets were not working in your room or if you had a personal items “thrown away”. Please let us know. We desire to rectify and fix and existing issue that may exist and also to check lost and found for you. Check in is guaranteed at 4pm, we do not charge for early check in and will do our best to accommodate any request. We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay.

Summary Heading: a wee bit away from town but nice
Summary: I needed to be at Saddleback College in Mission Veijo and thought I had better stay in SJC so I could have a chance at seeing the swallows. Too bad it wasn't migration time. I always look for BW first when I travel.  I know what I'll get and the rates will be decent. This hotel was a really nice example of what BW offers. Friendly staff, complementary breakfast, decent wifi and a good looking pool. I only put average on it because the location isn't ideal if you want to walk around the town. It's a fair walk from here to town. But if you're not concerned about that then give a very good without any problem. My air conditioner was nice and quiet.Right next door is the old Forster Mansion. You have to walk around the corner to get a good peak at it though. The mayor used to live

Need to be in Capistrano briefly and inexpensively - then this is your place.  Close to freeway and downtown SJC.  Rooms are clean and the Free breakfast makes the stay.  Internet speed (free) leaves you wanting.  I would not be able to conduct business at this property.  I was in town for a Memorial service and wanted to be close to downtown to avoid freeway traffic, which is constant in this area, especially on nice beach days.  The property works for short stays as it is closer to a truck stop than a hotel.

Very easy access, classic motel like design. Place was busy and I expected noise but was pleasantly surprised. Room are in good shape, very basic but clean. Breakfast was good with hot selections and plenty of space to sit down. If you are not looking for a fancy place, this is good value for money.

The hotel is easy access lots of parking staff is outstanding. Place is clean. They are always on site with maintenance keeping it clean . Lots of restaurants in the area just make sure you read the reviews before you go to them .I was there for two months .The Ocean is about 5 miles

I was working for two weeks in the San Juan Capistrano area.  Upon check-in I requested a King room instead of the two queen beds that had been assigned on the internet.  The young lady quickly helped me and got my room changed to one that would work for me as I would need to be working each evening.  The housekeeping staff came at different times each day and were very nice.  However, I think they finally changed the sheets on my bed the night before I left, and took the towels everyday, even though I hung them up to indicate that I would reuse them.  There was an issue with our sink, and maintenance just kept pouring chemicals in it.  My husband fixed it.  (Glad he came along!)  We were tucked back in the corner where it was nice and quiet and had a balcony to enjoy each

I arrived at the motel for a week, the airline I travelled with lost my baggage, the girls at the front desk were very helpful and sent me in the right direction to get some clothes and gave me some amenities 😊  The rooms were clean, beds were ok, pillows were a little uncomfortable, towels were changed everyday, beds were made daily as well The breakfast was ok. The only con is it wasn't walking distance to many places so if you do not bring a car I probably wouldn't recommend staying here Overall was extremely happy with the staff, always helpful and accommodating.

I reported the TV problem and the clerk on the phone told "me" how to fix it.  When that didn't work, I called back and she told me she would be right with me.  I stayed on the phone and when she came back she said "oh I meant that I was on my way over to your room."  She then said as soon as I'm done eating this banana I'll come by.    When she came, she was not able to reach the connection.  I then offered my granddaughter to attempt and she was able to do it.    In the morning, the TV was not working AGAIN!!!  I called and this time the technician came and fixed it.  I was very disappointed in all of this hassle.  In the end, I wasn't even offered a discount...  :(

Beware that the hotel is at a freeway exit and the roadway is under construction.  Altho the listing says walking distance to downtown, walking is impossible through the construction zone. Staff is very knowledgeable and helpful.

Summary Heading: Basic room at a very fair price
Summary: This hotel offers a basic room, and a very nice breakfast at a very fair price.  The hotel is a bit run down, but the rooms were clean and efficient.  The hotel is located conveniently right off the freeway and just a few blocks from the center of San Juan Capistrano downtown area.  So it's a great location.  There is a nice little pool for families.  Overall, it's a nice little hotel if you're looking for a low price and a safe overnight stay for individuals or families.
Manager Response: We appreciate your time taken to review our property. We are happy you had a chance to enjoy the complimentary hot breakfast. The hotel is currently 44% renovated and quickly moving towards a full renovation. We are happy you found our location convenient and noticed our guests enjoying the renovated pool. Our close proximity to the coast and great location in town can sometimes create challenging guest expectations, especially when the hotels reasonable price for the area is overlooked. We are happy you considered and noted our “fair price” in your review. Have a great day and we hope to see you again in the beautiful historical city of San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: We stopped here because we had been on the road for a long time. The bed was comfortable and clean, as well as the carpet and bathroom. Which I think should be a given, after all it's over a hundred a night.  Nice refrigerator and there is a microwave, which is nice if you plan to stay a few days. The pool looked very nice, we didn't use it. The breakfast is nice if you get there before they run out. We only had cold cereal, a bagel, and muffin and apple juice, they were out of orange juice, I had yogurt, which they came out later with. The Eggs and Sausage were out, and most all the muffins except banana. Which worked will for me, I can't have chocolate or orange juice, so for me it was fine. It was noisy at night because of a family above, but I have ear plugs so not a problem

A great location does not always a wonderful hotel make.  We started strong knowing we were staying in the absolutely charming San Juan Capistrano.  Unfortunately, from the moment we drove up, we knew this would not be a favorite.  The construction going on on the highway was bad enough, but then we found that the entrance to the parking lot is not clearly marked.  We drove right by it, and because it is on a highway, it is not easy to turn around.  A large group of traveling softball families were staying at the hotel and had basically camped out at the pool, were barbecuing and blasting their music, and proceeded to stay there all afternoon and evening.  My husband and I did not get to use the pool.  Once in our room, we noticed the Wi Fi was not connecting.  We called about
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback and share your experience. We are disappointed that the highway construction made it difficult to see the hotel signage. On a beautiful warm day during the hotels high season the hotels pool can reach capacity. We apologize for your inconvenience. We will do our best to assist with any internet issue that a guest’s computer is experiencing. We will refer guest to the tent card placed in there guest room and Cox communications to resolve the issue as they, the administrators have the ability to do so. Standard  Best Western properties are not brand required to serve Hot Breakfast. We are disappointed we could not meet your expectations and apologize for any inconvenience.

Summary: wow what a place   the breakfast well that is best down at the coffee shop   the rooms very spacious and nice   the location perfect  wow what a pretty little sleepy beach town that is   close to shopping for days   the bike place was closed the whole time we were there that was a bummer]   the pier dinning close to hotel is way over the top great place

This hotel is located a few feet from the 405 freeway. In addition to the constant noise and air pollution, the staff is rude, the rooms are stinky, and the manager is awful! He failed to maintain my credit card information, so he decided to lock me out of my room, and change the code, rather than attempting to contact me by either phone, email or in person!
Manager Response: The Best Western Capistrano Inn is conveniently located off the 5 freeway just two blocks from the heart of historical San Juan Capistrano and just minutes from beautiful Orange County beaches. Being close to the coast we can experience a “marina layer”: a cooling effect from the ocean water combined with warm air. Hotel policy requires additional paperwork when an in house guest extends a reservation. Guest was notified prior to keys being changed of this hotel policy. We are disappointed that we were unable to meet your expectations and apologize for any inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Not the best, not the worst
Summary: We were in town for New Years Eve to see the English Beat at the Coach House.  The hotel is decent...its what you would expect for the price.  Nothing fancy.  Bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  Staff was great and even allowed us a very late check out since we were up celebrating the new year until the wee hours of the morning.

We were visiting family and this hotel was recommended. We had a wonderful and restful stay.This survey is making me use at least 200 characters but there isn't much more to say. Staff was nice, the room was clean, quiet and peaceful. THe only annoying this now is writing this review but I know it helps others to find a good place to stay and this definitely was!
Manager Response: We want to say thank you for taking the time to comment on your experience. All feedback is shared and used to better serve our next guest. We are all happy that you had a restful and great stay in the beautiful historical city of San Juan Capistrano. We hope to see and welcome you back here soon!

Summary: We enjoyed our stay more than most other hotel stays in recent memory.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The size of the balcony was great,  It was probably 12 feet long and 4 feet deep with a few lawn chairs.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy their stay in this city.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your stay with us. We work hard to meet and exceed our guests’ expectations. We are pleased you enjoyed your stay and enjoyed our historical city. We are located two blocks from the heart of downtown San Juan Capistrano and just minutes for beautiful Orange County beaches. We appreciate you recommending our property to your friends and family!

Summary: The rooms are large & clean. Lovely linens & ample pillows. Rooms are quiet. There is a pool and a large conference room where a complimentary breakfast is served: cereal, waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, variety of muffins, coffee/tea, orange juice/apple juice, fruit, etc. Staff is helpful and friendly. There's free wifi. And close to the freeway.  The A/C is a bit noisy, but tolerable.

We stayed here based on the location to the mission.  It was very convenient , to the mission.  The rooms need a little tender loving care, the beds were good, the towels need to be replaced.  The curtains did not cover the complete doorway.  It was noisy, people marching on top of us, but we turned on the ac and that helped drown out the noise.  It did not feel very safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We are happy our location, just two blocks for Mission San Juan Capistrano was very convenient for you. Our property is currently 44% renovated. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by a noisy guest above you. Our two highest priorities will always be cleanliness and hotel guest safety. We appreciate your business and thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: Our stay of 3 night's could not have been any more relaxing. Newly renovated room, quiet, clean, good shower and very comfy bed. Amber at front desk pleasant and very helpful. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: We appreciate the time taken to review your stay with us at The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We continue to receive high praises for our newly renovated rooms, pool and complimentary Hot Breakfast. We share guest feedback with management and staff and as imagined, everyone left that day feeling great for the recognition of our hard work. Thank you for sharing your experience. We hope to see you again soon in the beautiful historical city of San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: Great if you like drunks sitting around in lawn chairs in the parking lot below your window until 1 a.m..  Apparently the staff has no problem with that.    And don't expect there to be anything but cold cereal and donuts for breakfast.  They don't make enough to last through breakfast hours, and the toasters are all broken.
Manager Response: We are disappointed to hear about your experience at The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We can assure you that the hotel has policies in place to eliminate and rectify most situations. We are hearing about this for the first time. We would love to listen to any unresolved issues and do our best to rectify them with you directly. We apologize for any inconveniences you may have experienced. We value our guests and appreciate your business and feedback.

Summary: We stayed in May for a couple of nights for a wedding. The staff at reception were very helpful. The room was fine, nothing too flash but a decent size, clean and the bed was big and comfortable. The bathroom is nothing flash but the shower was good. We had room 306 which was quite and on the ground floor. Didn't use the pool and breakfast was simple. Not a lot of choice in San Juan Capistrano but don't worry we found this place to be fine, if you expect 5 star then maybe this is not the place for you.

It was creepy/dirty/carpet  stained.  My door access cards did not work.  No elevator even though I had tons of luggage.  Asked and they said:  sorry, no elevator.  Dark end unit.  Ran to my car and locked the doors.  Front desk clerk had to try to let me in after 3 tries of walking in high heels back to get new access cards.  He had problems also.  Creepy people walking around behind me while trying desperately to get into my room.  Would NEVER stay there again!!!!!  Checked out immediately next day.

I was surprised to learn that the room only had ONE chair. Two beds, two tables, but only one chair? Since I was traveling with someone, we both needed to sit at a table to do work. When I called the front desk to ask for a second chair, I was told there were no more chairs, and each room only gets one chair. That seems pretty crazy to me. In just about every hotel I can ever think of there are at least two chairs.

the drive out to lake elsinore is right there   the best of both worlds is rignht there beaches to the left mountains to the right   aweseome  historic district great food all around a perfect geteaway when available   seems to be an always booked place but wonderful when lucky enought to get a reservation

We stay here every time we go to the San Juan Capistrano, Dana Point area. The staff is friendly and it is good value. I love the balconies. There is a decent pool and a tiny hot tub. The beds are super comfortable.

My family( two adults and 1 child), stayed for two nights in May to attend a family wedding over the weekend. At first I thought the proximity to the freeway would make it noisy but I slept comfortably and didn't notice any noise. the front door faced the pool and not the freeway. The building is old but well maintained. Staff was polite. The door was not installed properly (or perhaps due to earthquakes?) I notices the outdoor sunlight streaming in the very noticeable space between the door, the floor and walls. When we tried to lock the bolt lock, it didn't line up properly with the hole on the door jam and weren't able to use it (2nd floor). The regular door knob did work properly. The beds were too hard for my taste, but I did enjoy the water pressure in the shower, nice.

This hotel has a large base of construction workers as a base and does not cater to business clients at all. The breakfast served here in poor at best.  I had to use my smartphone as a hotspot in order to log into my office as the hotel internet would not connect.  When I called to make a reservation because I was having a problem logging into my BW account I was given a rate $34 higher than what was offered on line and told that is it if you don't like it you can go somewhere else.
Manager Response: Victor,  Staff and management continues to work together to improve communication and honor guest loyalty. Complimentary hot breakfast includes sausage patties, potatoes, waffles, eggs, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt and much more. Hotels Wi-Fi is currently meeting Best Western standards however we are excited to offer our guests an upcoming internet upgrade to exceed high speed internet growing needs. We appreciate your feedback and apologize for any poor service you received.

Summary: Came south to visit my best friend and watch the awful Pacquio/Mayweather bomb.  The hotel was much better than the fight by a long shot.  Lots of awesome eateries close by and some great antiques shops as well.  Oh, and we could have walked to the Mission if we wanted.  I'll stay here again when I come to see my pal.  The wife liked it too.

Things were pretty good. The breakfast selection was very good including hot waffles, potatoes, and sausage along with the normal continental fare. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. You didn't have to resign into the wi-fi all the time like most places. They are working on the Interstae 5/Ortega Hwy bridge so access was a little dicey but the location is very good other than that.

Swimming pool was out-of-service and the breakfast sucked! Keep it simple--the pool was out of service and the breakfast was one of the worst I have experienced since staying at another Best Western in Santa Rosa, CA.
Manager Response: We encourage and welcome all feedback from our guests. Were disappointed your expectations were not met. Our complimentary hot breakfast includes sausage patties, potatoes, eggs, variety of breads, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, coffee and much much more. We sincerely apologize for your inconvenience with our temporary pool closure. Our pool renovation is complete and we are enjoying the beautiful southern California weather, pool side!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, close to the downtown area, also close to a great mall with wonderful places to eat
Summary: This is a nice hotel with a nice pool area.  We really liked the balconies off of the room.  The ground floor had nice enclosed patios that made you feel safer.  The rooms were very comfortable.  It is so nice to have the microwave and mini fridge in the rooms.  The hotel is right off of the freeway but I was surprised that we didn't experience any road noise.  We were at the back and furthest away from the road that Im sure helped. The staff was very helpful in extending a late check out.  We didn't have a chance to eat at the breakfast served in the room next to the pool.

All in all, a good experience. Spacious room, comfortable bed (pillows adequate), convenient location, great breakfast selection and room setup, good pool, GREAT jacuzzi jets. For the price paid, an excellent value.
Manager Response: Betty, We greatly appreciate that you took the time to review your experience with us at BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We are very pleased to hear you had a great time not only with us, but in the beautiful, historical city of San Juan Capistrano as well. We hope to see you again soon and have a great week.

Summary: I'm spending one night here to meet up with a friend and see the Mission. From the pleasant receptionist to the great room, I am wowed. Seriously, look no further. Walking distance to the Mission and dining. Huge room. Great value.  A+
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing your stay with us at BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. With our convenient location, complimentary breakfast and newly remodeled pool, we are so happy to hear that you had a great stay. Please feel free to recommend us to family and friends in the area and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The hotel had everything I needed and the staff was really great. I found the bed exceptionally comfortable. The front desk even let me print my boarding ticket from there. Nothing fancy, but perfect for a place to sleep and it was a good placement for seeing San Diego and Los Angeles. I liked that this place didn't look like the classic square chain hotel.
Manager Response: Lauren, Thank you for taking the time to comment on your experience and for posting it online. We continue to receive much positive feedback via word of mouth. We hope and desire that these guests would take the time, like you did, to share their great experience online. We would love to see you again soon!

Summary: Great staff.. Very helpful. They are doing construction and the rooms are really dated.. But the staff makes up for that.. Weak in the breakfast area.. Pool under construction so not avalible. It has great potential.. Just needs better closets and a little updating..
Manager Response: Thank you for telling us about your stay at BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We appreciate the time you put into your review. We are happy we were able to be helpful and we apologize for our pool being temporarily out of use. Thank you again for providing us feedback that will better assist our next guest!

Summary: Right off the freeway, but newly remodeled and clean.  The outdoor pool was fairly large and warm and clean.  Light breakfast in the morning was sufficient .  For $132 a night thought it was good for the area. Would stay here again. Not much more to say but I have to write 160 words.

Summary Heading: Best Western Capistrano Inn, San Juan Capistrano
Summary: Probably you could find a better hotel for the price with things that work, such as keys, hot water, unstuck cabinets, sufficient lighting and with a heated pool. The jacuzzi holds 4 people, so you might have to take turns with some others!
Manager Response: David, Thank you sharing your feedback. We appreciate when we are given the opportunity to rectify a situation before a guest departure. We noticed your review online and opened a maintenance ticket for your room. One of the cabinet door latches needed repair and was fixed immediately. Hotel pool is heated to 80 degrees. We are sorry you did not notice the multiple wall switches for the canned lighting throughout the room. Have a good day!

Summary: Stayed in San Juan Capistrano for our anniversary (since we have never visited the city) and for the Swallows day parade. The Best Western was walking distance to down town and the start of the parade. Hotel staff was very accommodating and the free breakfast was much more than expected (Very Good). The room was clean with average furnishings but very comfortable.
Manager Response: Jeff, I am so happy to hear that you had a great time not only with us at the BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn but also that you enjoyed your time in beautiful San Juan Capistrano as well! We work hard to maintain hotel standards with cleanliness and staff friendliness and we are pleased that you noticed.

Summary: every thing was exceptional i will again try to stay at Best western  in any of my trip .i also tell my friend  to  use the best western for their trip any part of usa in future.  i know  for fact best western doing a great job . wish you all good luck .thanks Bizhan
Manager Response: Bizhan, Thank you so much for reviewing your stay with us at the BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we welcome you to recommend our hotel to your traveling friends and family in the future. Have a great day!

Summary: Good staff, comfortable rooms, very convenient to Old Mission at San Juan Capistrano (just across I-5 - we walked there).  Because the property is right off I-5, even with construction at the northbound off ramp, it is a good location.  Restaurants and shopping nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us at the BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we welcome you to reccomend us to friends and family who are visiting the area. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: On Sunday March 15th, I was checking into this hotel when this person in front of me started complaining about everything and anything that was not working and or broken in her room upon checking out. She was either trying her best to get a free night or her bill reduced. What got me was she started complaining about a room that she was in for over 4 or 5 days and picked her last day to complain about everything  she could think of. Only what impressed the hell out of me for I've been coming to this hotel now for over 5 years and the room this lady was complaining about just happened to be one of my favorite rooms. I know that every word this lady was saying was a lie. But again what impressed me so much was the way that the employee behind the desk was handling this person and

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel in San Juan Capistrano!
Summary: Great value, clean, inviting, with caring, efficient, and courteous staff.  Outdoor swimming pool delightfully refreshing---Jacuzzi in excellent working condition. Two computers---one in the breakfast room and one in the lobby--both excellently maintained and in fine working condition.  Upper rooms have outdoor balconies with tables and chairs---lovely for outdoor experience from the room.  Complimentary shuttle to and from Amtrak station and anywhere within a three-mile radius means for short stays no car is needed.  Shuttle driver is immensely helpful.  Entire staff is first-rate.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay with us at the BEST WESTERN  Capistrano Inn. We are so pleased to hear that you had a great experience with us, as customer satisfaction is one of our main priorities. We appreciate and value your feedback and we welcome you to recommend our property to family and friends. Hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Best Western in San Juan Capistrano
Summary: For the price this was a excellent choice.  We needed an overnight accommodation.  The room was comfortable and clean; the breakfast was bare bones but ok.  My only complaint is the noise from people coming back into the motel at 2-3:00 a.m.  Very noisy and couldn't sleep because of that.  Surprisingly, being close to the freeway was not a problem - it was other people making a disturbance.

Summary Heading: Close to where we needed to be... but
Summary: Pros: clean, friendly staff, continental breakfast, big comfortable bed, AAA discount, iron/board  Cons: backed up sink, tiny particle board closet that was falling over, very noisy (from upstairs movement and outside in the stairwell), expensive for what you get-other hotels were the same rate and much nicer
Manager Response: Jonathan, We always welcome and encourage any feedback, whether it be positive or negative, as we see it as an opportunity for growth. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced while staying with us at the BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We are disappointed to hear that another guest affected your experience in a negative light. Thank you very much for telling us about your stay with us.

Summary: This hotel is located right off the I-5.  We went to visit relatives at Camp Pendleton and this was so convenient.  The hotel was very clean and quiet.  The morning breakfast was adequate.  It is also very close to restaurants and the Mission which is also a "must see".
Manager Response: We value all guest feedback and we appreciate the time you spent commenting on your stay with us at BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience and we hope that you consider staying at our hotel again if you are in the area. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Located next to fwy so convent but a little noise.  Looks to be freshly remodeled. Staff very friendly.  Breakfast has a big selection and pool area was nice. They offer free internet which is good.  Also have a good size television for easy viewing

I have stayed at the Best Western San Juan Capistrano many times.The overall quality of staff and property is very good Excellent value and great location....Rooms are clean and very good value for my money

This hotel was close to the Mission and right off the Freeway. There was some road work going on out front and it was a little hard to get into the hotel. Breakfast was served in a room near the pool and was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for telling us about your stay with us at BEST WESTERN Capistrano Inn. We are so pleased to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us but we apologize for any inconvenience that road construction caused. We are looking forward to the completion of the roadwork this year as it's going to free up traffic and make travel much more convenient for visitors and residents. Once again, thank you for your review and we hope you consider our hotel again in the future.

Summary: Overall I enjoyed our biz stay but the pancakes were very disappointing.  I would have liked to see a better selection for the breakfast buffet, seating was generous however and so it was nice to visit with my partner in private.

This hotel is within walking distance to the Mission and Downtown San Juan Capistrano. Quaint hotel and a descent hot meal in the morning. Easy access to Interstate 5 and what Orange County has to offer. Definitely going to stay here again.

The Best Western Inn, San Juan Capistrano is a nice place, sufficient amenities, and a beautiful location.  The grounds were beautiful, very well maintained which made for an enjoyable stay. Definitely worth the stay!

Would highly recommend this to another. Had a great visit and it's a great central location to town the train the freeway the toll road and the beach the harbor and much more if you know where your going and if you don't the front desk will help you

The room was clean and  has a nice balcony. Average continental breakfast. The hotel is located close to the historical district of San Juan Capistrano which includes the mission. Staff is friendly, room is reasonably priced for the area and we recommend staying at this Best Western hotel when visiting the area.

Our experience was great!! I would stay here or at any other Best Western. If I didn't have my reservation confirmation. Then front desk would not have found my reservation. It was under a different name.

The first thing I do when I stay at a hotel is take the bedspread off the bed and never touch it again. I didn't have to that here. They had a white comforter with a white comforter cover that had an almost overwhelming smell of bleach...which I loved. Regardless, I still took a magnifying glass to it and not one stain, hair, basically anything you don't want to see could be located. I'm someone who douses rubbing alcohol on the remote, toilet seat, handles, light switches, doorknobs, etc. and who wears slippers in the shower at a motel so cleanliness is #1 important. Neurotic, maybe, but this is the first motel that I didn't feel I needed a hazmat suit to stay in.

I arrived and slept on one side of a king size bed only to awake the next morning to look for my cell phone and find the other side had blood stains on the bottom sheet.  They had obviously not changed the sheets from their last guest.  I will never stay at any Best Western again and suggest guests check sheets before getting into bed to sleep.  I let them know and took their survey, they promptly answered and asked what they could do to improve my stay - nothing I am still disgusted.
Manager Response: We value all guest feedback and are thankful for your time spent commenting on your experience. BEST WESTERN standards are among some of the highest in the hotel industry. The stripping of all bedding is done 100% of the time upon guest check out. We apologize and are disappointed if any stained bedding was overlooked and not discarded. Cleanliness of our guest rooms and guest security are our very highest priorities.

Summary: Very nice & clean. Pool area is very clean & has lots of seating to relax. Close to a lot of tourist attractions. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to friends
Manager Response: Thank you very much for telling us about your stay with us. We will do everything possible to create a welcoming and relaxing environment for all of our guests. We are pleased to hear you had a chance to enjoy some of San Juan Capistrano’s near by attractions, all within walking distance of the hotel. We appreciate and welcome you to recommend our property to your friends as you mentioned. Hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, particularly for the price.
Summary: If in the area, you ought to stay here. It's a < 10 min walk to the train station, very close to the mission (about 6 min walk) and historic san juan cap. The only concern is that the zone between the hotel and the mission/train station area is extremely pedestrian unfriendly. high traffic and a limited number of cross walks along with lots of freeway related construction.  Rooms and property are great, staff is friendly and they have a shuttle that will give you a complimentary lift to anywhere in the surrounding region, (you'll have to get back on your own, though).

Room was clean, smelled strongly of cleaner, but other than that it was very nice. Staff was nice and helpful as well. It was close to the location where we were going and there were decent places to eat close by.

This hotel is a good deal for the price you pay.  The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are pleasant.  The breakfast isn't awesome, but it is pretty good for this class of motel.  We had one problem with the coffee maker in our room, which the staff took care of quickly and efficiently.  I would stay here again for sure.

We wanted a place close to the Coach House and this hotel was perfectly located right off of the freeway. The free hotel shuttle dropped us off at the Coach House. The room was nice and roomy and the bed was super comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast was also a decent version of continental. The shower massage was an added bonus! Next time I will remember to bring a bathing suit for the pool and jacuzzi.

I'd say this hotel is very nice overall; it could be 3.5 star with a few minor adustments, like room smell, worn-out towels.  Check in Clerk could be more enthused and professional...was not satisfied with his attitude.  Breakfast was kind of mediocre, boiled eggs instead of freshly cooked eggs and sausage or bacon.

We stayed overnight for my son's sporting event which was conveniently close to the hotel.  Construction still going on and hard to locate and get into. Room itself was clean and cozy stayed in back of hotel so no traffic noise but because of age of building you could here people talking in the hall.  All in all good room and would stay there again.

Breakfast was great. I  was hoping to get two beds because I had my daughter with me. My business meetings did not go so well lack of sleep, I had people talking out side my room and I had a hard time sleeping because we were cramped in one bed.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for taking time out to comment on your stay with us. Were happy to hear you enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in our spacious breakfast room. We will 100% guarantee your room type reserved at time of booking and will do our very best to accommodate any changes or special requests. Thank you again for your time. On behalf of the entire staff we hope to see you again soon here in our beautiful historical city of San Juan Capistrano.

Summary Heading: An OK place, but it would have taken so little to make it much better.
Summary: I chose this hotel based on its location near family that I was visiting, and I stayed there November 11-14, 2014.  I echo the observations of other reviewers about it needing a serious update, and about it being difficult to get in and out of due to construction.  My additional observations are related to how easy it would be to turn this property from "OK" to "good."  Its management seems simply not to care.  My room had a nice computer desk, which was unusable due to a lack of electrical outlets.  How difficult would it have been to put in desk lamps with an electrical plug at the base?  My room had a phone with a message light that never shut off.  How difficult would it have been to put instructions by the phone on how to turn the message light off?  My room had a microwave

Comfortable hotel.  Rooms in need of upgrading, especially the carpet.  Breakfast was nice.  Very close to the 5 Freeway, so highway noise is an issue.  Construction going on all around the hotel, very hard to find and get into driveway.  Bed was very confortable.

Have stayed here in the past. Tried it again and still not up to par. A/C needs updating, the room needs new paint, carpet. Bathroom update. Bed is hard, not comfortable at all. Hope they can get it together and make it a Best Western Plus. Room rate high for the condition it is in.

Summary Heading: Can't Even Keep my beer cold
Summary: Only reason I picked this hotel is that is was near a wedding i was attending. I thought....how bad could it be...its a best western. First, there was soo much construction around the hotel, it made it difficult to get to. Then, while getting ready for the wedding, we wanted to partake in some beverages as a pre-pre-cocktail hr and it was like the fridge wasn't even on. Nothing like a warm beer.

We spent a couple of nights at this motel while visiting San Juan Capistrano. We found it very convenient to visiting the local attractions and restaurants. There was some major roadwork being done at the on and off ramps to the highway, which are adjacent to the motel location.  Check in was quick and easy. We had a balcony room reserved and were assigned one at check-in. I would recommend a room in the 400 section of the property, between 406 and 410. These rooms are on the second level and overlook a business park, which is better than being close to the highway or looking into the parking lot. The room buildings are two story, with no elevators. Our room was huge and as I stood on my balcony and looked at room 411, it did not extend as far as 410.  Our room was equipped with
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to comment on your experience with us. We are all happy to hear your accommodations were comfortable and that you noticed the many new upgraded room amenities. Just like you did, our staff enjoys the convenience of our local attractions and restaurants daily so we are pleased you took advantage of them during your stay. We are staying busy, hard at work to make our next guest feel welcomed and at home. Thank you for visiting the beautiful historical city of San Juan Capistrano.  Sincerely,  Staff and Management

Summary: This is great hotel with many great things to do in the area and many fine dining establishments within walking distance. We enjoy the quiet atmosphere and great service provided. We also like the convenience of the 24 Hour Fitness that is within walking distance. The staff if very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We would like to say thank you for commenting on your stay. Our staff was happy you hear you enjoyed the many things to do within walking distance in our beautiful city. We hope you would reach out if we could do anything for you in the future.   Sincerely,   Staff & Management.

Summary: I felt compelled to write an update to my last review.  Our second stay at this Best Western was much more pleasant and satisfying than the last.  There has obviously been an effort by management to upgrade not only the service but the plant itself.  We found staff to be courteous and helpful. (Only exception was the young man who tended the breakfast room on the week-end.  He was more interested in his cell phone than cleanliness or service.) Our room was very comfortable and looked to be newly refurbished.  The breakfast offerings are still somewhat meager, but sufficient none the less.  We will be visiting the area again, and next time around look forward to staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: It wasn't Bad but expected better being in the City of San Juan Capistrano
Summary: Air conditioner did not work properly when we arrived and this was during the heat wave we experienced from the tropical storms . It kept kicking off. Maintenance came up and said that there was nothing much that he could do about it so my husband fooled with it and got it to work, thank god. I expected better quality for being in San Juan Capistrano and the breakfast was limited. I think they can step it up a notch. Otherwise, the beds and service was good.

Very friendly helpful staff, hotel near busy road but our room was still quiet. The room was very comfortable, was road works in area so had to be careful entering hotel. The township is over the other side of motorway, just a short drive,

This was a nice hotel, for the price and location. We did make the reservation very last minute but still got a good deal. The area around the hotel was under construction so it wasn't so welcoming at first but it was nice and calm once we checked in! I recommend this hotel if you're looking for a average hotel :)

Stayed there for one night on our way to San Diego. Many decent Restaurants just around the corner. Nice, clean rooms, small breakfast and not at all crowded pool - definitely would stay there again!  Free wifi available. Manager was nice and gave us some info about where to dine on our stay.

The service and cleaniness of the rooms were good. The breakfast bar could have had a little more selection.   I would return to this hotel and other Best Westerns.  Would recomend to my friends to stay there.

It was a clean hotel to stay in.  Being 5'2", I had to pole vault onto the bed, but it was comfy!!  The breakfast in the mornings were great and filling.  There was always food available.  It was also quiet at night. The hot tub only held a maximum of 4 people and we had a large group so we didn't use it.

Everything was fine except for the couple roaches I saw - where there is one, there are more.  Other than that the place is on par w/other Best Westerns. There is construction going on on the frontage road which makes finding the entrance a bit tricky but that should clear up when the work is completed. The breakfast was cold but ample and varied for different options on multi-nite stays.

Great hotel! Friendly staff, clean rooms & they have Balconys too with chairs to enjoy the view of the Hills. The room has a very comfy leather recliner that makes you feel at home. Great location - near Freeways and near the Mission of San Juan Capistrano.

Summary Heading: Very nice clean place to stay
Summary: This place is clean good staff.   It's almost like a resort.   The room is very clean.   Im happy to have found this place.  I stay here whenever I'm in town.  Very very clean.  Average furniture for a best Western but kept up very well and newly remodeled.

This is my favorite Best Western of all time as it is consistently clean, relatively quiet and a value vs. other hotels in the SJC area. If the road construction nearby ever gets done, this will be once again a great place to stay.

The room was clean, but it was obviously an older hotel that has been kinda renovated. Had a terrible experience with housekeeping who decided to ignore the do not disturb sign on the door and knock on the door at 8am, 9am and 10am. When I asked her why, she just said "I'm just doing my job". Apart from that, I still love the changes Best Western are making to their brand. Wi-Fi was very fast....that's a big plus for me!

I booked this hotel through Priceline. Long and short of my story is that my credit card got double charged. Several months later, I decided to give them a 2nd chance because I heard they had remodeled the hotel and had a new staff.  BIG MISTAKE! My card was double charged AGAIN!  This hotel will guarantee you pay twice.   Otherwise the hotel remodel was decent and the staff was helpful - until I had to call them 4x about my credit card issue (after the fact)
Manager Response: Hello, we want to thank you for voicing your feedback. We always desire to improve and your comments will allow us to direct our focus. Our sincere apologizes for your inconvenience. Third party websites will generally bill you upfront and then at check in the hotel will authorize a credit card as well. We will always do the right thing in the end and we are happy your enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you would reach out to us if we can do anything for you.   Sincerely,   -Robert

Summary: This hotel is difficult to get to because of all of the construction in the area.  This has been going on for awhile, no fault of the hotel.  We had a hard time booking because two desk clerks in a row were rude when we called.  One even said there were no rooms and when we called the corporate booking main line they did have rooms???  Anyway, it is inexpensive, we had stayed there before, and we were going for a long weekend so we booked it anyway.  The hotel is adequate; clean, beds are comfortable and it is relatively quiet.  The breakfast is minimal, but it is free.  Pool is ok, Jacuzzi is very small and only around 93 degrees.  Still good to relax in though.

Summary Heading: Good little place for a quick stop.
Summary: This is a clean hotel with a nice front desk staff.  Very clean and very lean.  The rooms are sparse and use bed spreads for those of you who would rather have duvets.  They have the older type air conditioners but there are refrigerators in the rooms.  Freeway close but not too close where you hear all the noise.  The breakfast is not all that great but okay for a quick bite to grab.  Coffee makers in the room but no tea.  All in all I stay there because every time the front desk is so nice to me and I know the place will be clean and quick to get on and off the freeway!

A great place to party late into the night. If, however, you want a decent night's sleep, go elsewhere. Pool parties until dawn. Management does not care. multiple calls to the front desk proved ineffectual.Police were called, but the partiers returned.

This Best Western is one of the older hotels but is still in good condition.  The room was large with a king size bed and flat screen TV.  WiFi was fast and free.  We had a large bathroom and separate vanity area.  It was clean and comfortable.  The Inn also had a nice pool and a continental breakfast was included in the price of this room.   The only problem was the noise outside and in the room above us.  But this Inn seems to attract young families, so it’s to be expected.  I kept hearing someone outside our room during the night on a walkie talkie, so I assume they had security checking the grounds.  All things considered, it was a good value for the price.
Manager Response: Hi! We want you to know that we value you as our guest and appreciate your business. Feedback is our greatest tool we use to better serve our next guest. We are happy to hear about your great experience. Cleanliness and guest security are two of our top priorities. Our property being just four short miles to some of the most beautiful southern California beaches we pride ourselves in our exceptional value and our welcoming guest service. Thank you and have a great summer!  Sincerely,   -Robert

Summary: All the employees we encountered were also pleasant and helpful. This trip was planned as a special get away for me and my daughter for her 13th birthday. We had a great time in the city and were very pleased with our experience at the hotel. We especially enjoyed the free shuttle as it allowed us to explore the city of San Juan Capistrano. This service is one of the highlights I conveyed to all my friends and family when sharing the great memories created by this trip.

Very affordable and great amenities for the price. Clean rooms, comfortable bed, good service, friendly staff. Wonderful continental breakfast all four days. Although a sliding glass door was not functioning properly and due to construction, the entry/exit from the hotel was difficult, we would stay at this location again. It was, overall, a most pleasant, friendly, affordable stay.

hotel is ok,rooms were clean, staff service was nice,the problem was the water in pool,too cold,the answer was the vacations season was just starting,probably next week would be ok.Next week is going to be too late for my family.I recommend hotels should let customers know about the inconvininces they have before booking our rooms,in case we don't like to go through this problems.
Manager Response: Carlos,  We appreciate your review as it provides us valuable information. We want to thank you for your business. We are pleased you enjoyed the room and staff service. We apologize for the pool not meeting your expectations. The pool is heated to 78 degrees. Again, your feedback is appreciated/ shared with staff and management and it helps us improve our next guest’s experience.

Summary: We come as a group to this hotel after a mission trip into Mexico.  They were ready for us, checked us in quickly and we were able to enjoy the evening.  Hot tub and pool were enjoyed, and walking distance to Pizza for group dinner.
Manager Response: The Best Western Capistrano Inn values our relationship and appreciates your business. Our staff and I love welcoming Life Point Church and caring for all your lodging needs. We will continue to do everything we can to make our guest feel welcomed and comfortable. Pizza is a favorite of mine as well as I will often walk over there for lunch or to some of the other great choices downtown in our very quaint and historical city. Thank you.

Summary: Stayed 2 nights ...bed very comfortable .....breakfast in the morning loved the new pancake maker plenty of variety.  requested a lower level room with no problems, only staircase.  Used their shuttle to take us uptown.  Can't wait till all the construction is complete on new overpass

Our rooms were clean and had comfortable beds. Staff were helpful and pleasant. The refrigerator/freezer was noisy which was annoying at night when trying to sleep. I could hear just about every step from the room above so that woke me up a few times during the night. It didn't bother anyone else. The Inn is next to the freeway so there is freeway noise but it wasn't a problem for us. In front of the Inn, there is road construction and heavy traffic on Ortega Hwy.

This is a quality hotel for the moey and the location just off the Ortega HWY exit is perfect. At the time of my stay there is contruction which makes it difficult to exit but its worth staying here. I stayed in a room with a balcony which made it especially nice. The break feast is very good and worth staying for.

Summary Heading: Thinnest walls ever in my life.
Summary: We wanted a hotel near the mission, so we picked this one. I read the reviews, but the draw of the location made me disregard the negative comments. This hotel isn't great and it's a tad run down, but the worst part is the noise.  I can hear every word of a conversation happening in the hall outside my door. I was woken up by the snoring of the man sleeping above us. In the morning I could easily hear the guy next to us urinating in his toilet. I wasn't looking for luxury, but I was hoping for standard privacy and quiet.  I would never stay here again. Glad our was a one night stay.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We will always do our best to make our guest feel welcomed and comfortable. In room privacy is a high priority of ours and we will not allow this to be compromised. I apologize for the noise issue during your stay. We generally do not hear comments that are reflective of yours however we would like to apologize again for the inconvenience. We are disappointed we failed to meet your expectations.

Summary: Everything was clean, the staff was helpful and considerate. Breakfast was good. I was hoping for biscuits and gravy or scrambled eggs, and there wasn't any, but the rest of it was well-presented, the area was kept clean, and the food itself was very good. This motel met the what we have come to expect from Best Western, and we are very happy with the experience.

We had checked in at the hotel, the minute we arrived I saw bugs on the bathroom floor. Thought they were ants, buty then I went into the shower area to discover more bugs. And these were not ants. I informed the desk that there was numerous bugs in the room. He went to look at it the room to confirm my findings. He then returned to the desk and said they were just ants. I informed him that they were not just ants and he continued to disagree with me and say they were. But little did he know that I am licensed by the state for pest control inspection and service. Yes they were definetly not ants!! They looked like bird mites, and these can be a real pain in the behind if you take them home with you. They will bite you and leave marks. And they arent the easiest to get rid of and
Manager Response: Anthony, we value your business and feedback. When this issue was brought to us in the morning and after speaking with you, as we previously stated we needed to determine the “Insect” type as part of required procedures in order to properly terminate any issue. After our investigation it was determined the insects were pirate bugs. Recent rain may have driven them into this room. I assure you this issue has been terminated. We sincerely apologize for your inconvenience. We are always quick to rectify any issue that may arise. Upon our agreement we discounted your room for any troubles of yours.

Summary: Easily the worse hotel stay in recent memory.   I check in and have one simple request. Please place me in a quiet room.   I check into a room and hear barking. Its a dog in the room below me. A really kind housekeeper sees me staring at the dog and starting to put my things back in my car so I can get another room.   Turns out the room she found for me was booked. Upon heading back to my room, what do I see? Another dog.   Dogs are allowed anywhere in this hotel.   When the front desk called with another room request it was in the other area with the dog. I decided to take my chances and stay in my room.   The front desk claimed they had no idea about the dog below me. Fine. I can see that happening.  However, I begin to hear loud blaring music in the room next to me. I can
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay. The Best Western Capistrano Inn Is pet friendly, however we do have specific rooms for pets. We apologize for the noise issue during your stay. We value opportunities to rectify issue that may arise during a guests stay. When we are not informed of an issue and given the opportunity to respond we lose our chance to provide the service and accommodations we strive to give. Hotel policy is in place that empowers staff to take the necessary steps to resolve such issues. Again we greatly apologize for your inconvenience.

Summary: This motel has seen better days. Location, once the freeway gets fixed, is central with easy access to restaurants and shopping. Stayed in a king bed room downstairs. Noise from the upper balcony reverberated with luggage wheels clacking and people walking. Definitely not as good as other Best Westerns I have stayed at.  Staff makes up for much of this place's shortcomings as everyone was friendly, courteous, helpful and accommodating.

This is a dated 1980 Motel, with up-grades.  I would advise a early arrival as the place filled fast..Major road construction at the drive way. I would stay again but only for ONE DAY. Sad breakfast.  Nothing close for food...The construction should be complete June 2014.
Manager Response: Thank you for your “good stop” and taking the time to share the feedback. We are pleased you noticed the many up-grades at the property. We are continuing to focus on exceeding guest expectations. We apologize for any inconvenience with city road construction. With many shops and restaurants within walking distance and just three short blocks from the mission we are proud to welcome our guests into the "improving" historical town of San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: As you can tell from the report I've stayed there before and the grounds are nice and peaceful and you can walk to a recommended restaurant from the property convenient location I stay there when I have to put my car in the shop.

This hotel is easily accessed from anywhere in San Juan Capistrano. It is well maintained with beautifully kept landscaping and the outer walkways and parking lot are cleaned regularly. My room was up to date, and clean with a very comfortable bed.

My family had come down with the flu and we needed to find a hotel during Christmas weekend. With the reviews being somewhat consistent, I would have expected a little more. Our trip was already setback after everyone came down with the flu, so we were grateful to have found a place to stay for the entire weekend. Well, that was soon diminished by the greeting we received by the completely unenthusiastic front desk agent. Our room was next to a staircase, which I understand has to be filled at some point, but at the very least advise your guest on the location. The next morning, we had no hot water and the response we got (didn't include an apology from the front desk agent) was, "Give it five minutes,  the pipes are old." So, after the second phone call I asked for the manager,

This is a nice, basic motel/inn. And while the digs would be considered normal (not fancy), the staff is GREAT! They are very friendly and helpful, so big points for that! This place is easily accessed from the 5 Freeway off at Ortega and is (except for the current construction) walkable (although they do have a van) to historic downtown San Juan Capistrano's mission, restaurants and train station. We used it for guests coming for an event downtown….. and everyone was happy!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We are pleased to hear that you noticed some of the many near by attractions. We pride ourselves in creating a welcoming environment and our dedication to cleanliness. We are also striving to continue to offer the best value for amenities offered in South Orange County. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times for business. The rooms are nice and roomy, the balconies are the best to relax on after a long day at work. The best is the greatest BBQ place I've found is within walking distance from the Hotel. It's got great food, a lot of fun and fun people; the locals are what makes this eatery feel like the best perk to the hotel. The combination of the hotel being a place with a sense of pride and to get a great meal right around the corner, is the place for me to relax after a long day's work, to just enjoy the ambiance of the area.

This Best Western is very conveniently located close to I-5, also a high-end mall with a fine portrait art gallery that was the object of our visit. The price was very good, so I am reluctant to mention that the overall area could use a sprucing up, but it could.

Right off freeway, minutes from San Juan Capistrano attractions. Modest hotel with dated accommodations.  Good deal on booking.com. As a note, do be cautious of the fog that rolls in off the ocean. No one warned me and it was an ordeal to drive thru thick evening fog to reach hotel.

Located off a main roadway, older property, walk outs, clean with your basic furnishings. Room was quiet, beds were so so. Able to park in front of your room easy to cart your luggage in.  Will probably do a return visit in May on a motorcycles trip

I have stayed at this property many times for one reason or another.  It is always clean and in good working order. The staff always provides efficient service. The breakfast is pretty basic for this type of accommodation.  My only complaint is in the quality of coffee in the room. It is really quite bad.  I will definitely stay here again whenever I am in the area and needing a place to sleep without frills, but wanting something more that a Motel 6 experience.

Summary Heading: Best just continues to be the Best.
Summary: When I am in Los Angeles and needing a place to stay that has all the comforts of home. I will continue to choose the Best Western chain hotels. This particular hotel is the best I've been to in Los Angeles. Not only do you have the enjoyment of a warm pool steps away from your door. The hot tub is always warm and ready for you. If that don't get your fancy. How about walking the 20 to 30 feet over to the Bowling Alley and have fun with the family or just alone. I for one am a bowler and have to say with the coupon the hotel gives you for buy one get one free where can you go wrong. Lanes are the cheapest I've seen for a game. When you're in the mood to sing or just have a cold drink. The bar is very convenient as well. I enjoy the snack bar that is in same building as the lanes

The location here is great. The staff was very helpful. The rooms have a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bed was firm, but was comfortable. We requested second floor and that was provided. The breakfast was adequate, but the only eggs were hard boiled and there was no meat provided. We found plenty to eat!  The rooms had granite counters in bath area and there was plenty of hot water for the shower. The hotel is walking distance to downtown SJC, the Mission and the train. The hotel has a shuttle that you can use if you don't want to walk through the construction area. The construction will continue for at least another year.  Overall we found this to be the best location and price in the area. It's not fancy but it does the job.

Summary Heading: Good location spoiled by construction and traffic.
Summary: The major problem with this hotel is the construction on the new ramps for I-5.  There is no sign easily visible at night on the Ortega Highway, so when we got off I-5 we drove past the hotel at first.  Because traffic was squeezed into two fewer lanes than normal, it was impossible to take a left turn when leaving the hotel; we had to go right and u-turn.  The Mission, the shops and restaurants are withing easy walking distance, but getting there takes forever because you have to cross Ortega several times (the sidewalk is blocked by construction first on one side then on the other) and the traffic requires that you wait for crossing lights.  None of this is the hotel's fault, of course.  Check in was courteous and efficient, as was check out.  The room  was good sized and had

We were attending the Rodeo.  It was a short drive to the Rodeo. Ad just a few minute walk the train station, dinner at the El Adobe and dancing at the Swallows nest.  Great location, clean.  Walls are thin so you can hear the neighbors TV.   Overall - very happy with our stay.

I could not believe this from a Best Western.  Sometimes its the little things that add up to an overall impression.  First off we were put in a room with 2 queen size beds instead of the king we had requested.  No big deal - it worked.  Secondly the bathroom amenities were seriously lacking.  You get soap and shampoo, that's it.  There was no lotion, no conditioner and no bath mat.  When I asked for at least a bath mat, we were then shorted one large towel.  Really?  As mentioned by a previous reviewer, the breakfast selection was meager and not all that inviting.  Because we paid top dollar during the summer, I must say that we seriously overpaid for this experience.  We were at the hotel for several days so, as I said, it was the small things that added up to less than a

good location although it can be a walk to sightsee. you see I did not have car. it would have been nice if the hotel staff informed me off rides available.  I would advise to have a car as this is not a walkable area.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking time to comment about your recent stay. Your feedback helps us make adjustments, creating better experiences for guest in the future. We have a complimentary shuttle to get guests around town. I apologize for no one informing you about this service at check in. We appreciate your business and hope to see you next time you visit the beautiful town of San Juan Capistrano..

Summary: Very pleasant, clean and convenient to everything we wanted. The only drawback was the road construction nearby. And we do understand that project will be completed soon! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

Summary Heading: Dino & Sheila California... Best experience I've ever received from any Hotel.
Summary: I first started going down to San juan Capistrano I was staying at another hotel until I found this one. It's close to everything. Store's, train, restaurants and shopping. I have been staying at this Best Western going on two years now and I still look forward on each visit seeing all the friendliest staff. The check in time if you could even call it "Time" Is the fastest. The Rooms are always clean. Plenty of extra towels, blankets, Ice and the pool and hot tube are always very clean and relaxing. This has to be one of the best if not the  best chain hotel I have ever stayed. Right now even with all the construction going on the place is still beautifully cleaned. Robert G and his staff have been the best on all our visits and Sheila and I are looking  forward to seeing

I stayed here 2 weeks ago and had never stayed at a best western before. The rooms were clean and the front desk staff was great! Free breakfast and it was a quality breakfast with aloy of variety in a clean clubhouse! The only downfall that I found was that there was limited parking so if you got there too late, you may have had to park all the way on the other side of the property. Check out was fast and easy and will definitely stay here again

Another case of "Don't judge a book by it's cover."  Rooms have been refurbished and were in nice condition.  Very clean property with easy parking and paper towel dispensers in the parking lot.  Bed was extremely hard and I slept poorly. I note others thought that the beds were "comfortable".  Proving once again, that everyone is different.     Breakfast was really good and included yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cereals, fruits and breads and a pancake machine.   Per my 16 yr. old son, this motel had the 2nd best breakfast of our trip.    Close to  Highway 101 and pleasant employees.

Summary Heading: Ok except for very hard beds
Summary: Hotel was ok, but the only thing I didn't like was the very hard beds I woke up 3 times in the night because my back was hurting because of the hard beds, I felt I was sleeping on the floor with very thin mattress, other than that it was fine, basic breakfast.  You get best selection on breakfast if you arrive early, by 8:30 the breakfast was almost gone.  We got a room on the back and the balcony didn't have a view we were only able to see another building and debris outside but we opened the sliding door for the fresh air so it was ok.

The Best Western Hotel at Capistrano was absolutely wonderful.  The room was lovely as well as the outside grounds.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was equiped with a lot of lighting. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was also very well presented.

The hotel had gone through a complete renovation since the last time that I stayed there. Totally satisfied with the accommodations and service. Marcos behind the desk was extremely helpful and knowledgeable..

Comfortable and convenient location to downtown San Juan Capistrano.  The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean, large and nicely furnished.  Would recommend as a place to stay.

If you can, stay in the rooms close to the pool. The rooms on the exterior face the Highway and while it wasn't noisy - I think it could be at times. There is a lot of road construction around the hotel but it's doesn't affect your stay. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good - no hot items - and was constantly replenished. The guy was run off his feet so not in a great mood but he did his job. the location is good, a short drive to the mission and the main street with all the restaurants, etc. if you wanted you could probably walk but it's a little challenging with all the road works right at the moment. Good value for money - Great for kids!

If you need a reasonable, friendly location to stay while travelling to or from San Diego, I highly recommend BW Capistrano Inn. Conveniently located just off the 5 FWY, the surrounding area is gorgeous with horse ranch property and just an overall nostalgic ol' town feel. Upon check-in, we received a warm friendly welcome by Rob Grether, & equally welcome by staff coupled with a clean, [spouse approved] room, which made for a pleasantly surprising rest stop along the way. Minutes from downtown SJC,   I would also recommend the Hidden Coffee shop we discovered adjacent to the Amtrak station. Zoomars Petting Zoo is just next door too, a bonus for the kids & parents alike looking to keep travel low stress ~ Thank you Rob & staff, we'll be back again!

Summary Heading: Great Location in San Juan Capistrano
Summary: Ideally located, right next to I-5, but be cautious of interchange construction right in front of the hotel. At cetain times of the day, it ca be impossible to make a left out of the property (towards I-5 and downtown) due to construction trafiic backup. That being said, it is a nice property, with all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

Traffic is terrible right now due to road construction next door but it should be better soon.  We didn't hear the noise while in our room.  It is too bad that the town is on the other side of the freeway so the trip would have been walkable but when construction is finished, it may be.  Hotel was comfortable and spacious.
Manager Response: Thank you for spending time rewiewing your stay at The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We are located just three blocks from the historical mission and downtown shops and restaurants. We are confident guest will be pleased choosing to stay in the beautiful town of San Juan Capistrano. Our complimentary shuttle would love to escort guests around town. Located just 4 miles to the beach our low rates are amenities are unmatched.

Summary Heading: Noisy.  The night we stay there students rented a room for prom night.
Summary: Screaming and whistling and knocking on room 402 thru out the night.  The front office knew about the noise but did not called the police to stop this bad behavior.  At 1:00 a.m. they still were screaming in the halls and whistling .  Several customer compliant to the front desk but the noise continued.  We will never stay at this B.W. again.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your stay at The Best Western Capistrano Inn. We are disappointed a few loud guests ruined your stay with us. Hotel procedures will be reviewed to address this issue and to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future. I am disappointed we could not provide the service we strive for. Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: I've been here several times when I see shows at The Coach House. and plan on doing it again. It is walking distance from the train station, the mission, and the downtown section as well. The last time I went I found out that they provided shuttle service to and from The Coach House as well! They said it was a common occurrence for them.  Over the years, I have seen this place evolve from a simple cinderblock motel into a pleasant stay with a showing of commitment to updating itself and staying relevant. The lobby is bright and inviting and the staff is friendly and still gives the feeling of being in a small community. That's an accomplishment for a stay at a hotel chain.

Summary Heading: Not perfect, but much better than expected!
Summary: This was my first stay at this property and I would say I would definitely come back.  I booked two rooms on Hotwire and paid $70 each for a Sunday night.  I was going to Laguna Beach for the day but since the rooms were about double I decided a fifteen minute drive wouldn't be so bad.  My party arrived in San Juan Capistrano around noon so we decided to call to see if we could possibly check in any earlier than the 3 pm check in.  To our surprise, the front desk said both of our rooms were ready and it was no problem.  We were delighted because we wanted to drop off our stuff before heading out to Laguna.  Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff was very friendly.  We went to our rooms but it turned out only one was really ready.  We didn't make a fuss since we were
Manager Response: The Best Western Capistrano Inn encourages all guest feedback. The time reviewing your stay is appreciated. It helps inform us of how to better serve our next guest.
