Our goal will always be to improve and exceed our guest expectations. Your business is valued and your experience is motivating and encouraging to my staff and I.  Thank you,  Robert Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661 Ext.450

Summary: The rooms were very clean and easy access to the freeway. The attendant at the desk was very helpful. The continental breakfast was great, lots of choices. I loved the automatic pancake maker and it made wonderful pancakes

Big rooms, clean hotel, easy free parking. A bit of a long walk to the downtown shops and, restaurants, you may want to drive down and park. It's the only hotel in the immediate area so it has to do. Would recommend it for a night or two if you are going to see the mission and historic downtown area or are in town for business, otherwise the nearby beach city hotels are better located for walking to amenities..

Summary Heading: Great hotel for anyone going to the Coach House
Summary: THis hotel is one exit up from the The Coach House and it takes less than 10 minutes to get there by streets.   Hotel was VERY clean and staff friendly and helpful. Old style hotel with doors facing out into the parking lot;  shower curtain and furniture shows some wear, but again, very clean and neat.   We loved the comfy recliner in the room.   Nice to have somewhere to sit besides a hard chair or the bed.  Construction going on next door to the hotel, so being woken up to the sound of equipment and buildings being destroyed was not pleasant, but it had nothing to do with the hotel itself - just its proximity.

Attended a concert at The Coach House and stayed here. Informed them that I was going to have a little before & after party with sime friends and my room was located in the back with a balcony and a nice view of the western hillside. Perfect. I will stay here again.

I know that Best Western is a motel, not a fancy hotel. That being said, I was still disappointed. After a struggle to pull out the chair from the desk, my hands were sticky. After washing my hands and sitting, I was looking at the bed. It was so unappetizing. the bedspread was frayed with little strings sticking out all over the place. While it is normal for the sink area to be separate from the toilet/shower area, this one was oddly situated. The whole room just had a hodge podge feeling and I was there to relax. Being that we were less than a couple hours from home, we drove home instead of staying there. I preferred my clean bedroom. The front office staff was pleasant enough-nothing special. Yes, it's walking distance to the mission, but you would have to walk over a
Manager Response: We appreciate the time spent reviewing your experience of the Best Western Capistrano Inn. We will continue to strive to exceed guest expectations and provide exceptional customer service. Your feedback is valued and it will be shared with staff and management. Our sincere apologizes for any inconvenience you experienced and for falling short of your expectations. We offer a complimentary shuttle service as we understand crossing the highway overpass can seem dangerous.   Sincerely,  Rob Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661 Ext.450

Summary Heading: People that Care - Pet Friendly and People Friendly
Summary: I have stayed here at least 3 times before.  I was inadvertently billed for having a pet and called the GM. He was empathetic, understanding and listened and corrected the bill since I was not aware of the charges. Suggested they put up a clear sign to prevent this in the future....

I have stayed at this motel several times and love it because:  1.  I have almost always been able to get a room for $40-60 per night by bidding on Priceline. 2.  I come to the area to hike or bike in the Cleveland National Forest and to go to the beaches, and there is NO place better located for these activities. 3.  I often come with my dog, which only costs me $20.  Plus, I find the place to be very dog friendly and especially like the fact that there is a hose by the pool that I am always allowed to use to wash the dog off if she has been at the beach.  As for the usuals, who would complain about any free breakfast when they're paying as little as $40 a night?  The service has always been good.  The rooms are what you would expect from a Best Western.  The upper level rooms

Summary Heading: Good hotel for a night's sleep
Summary: Stayed here in November 2012 for a night after getting off a flight from London Heathrow. The room was what I expected, and had good wifi. Would recommend this hotel for a base and the breakfast was ok.

I stayed at this hotel recently and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, the shower worked well and the staff was professional and friendly. The gift shop had a nice supply of snacks and drinks, plus there is a Denny's in the parking lot. All in all, I was quite impressed, with one exception...  The internet wifi service was horribly slow. It performed about as well as a dial-up connection. As someone who relies on having good access wherever I stay for work reasons, I was disappointed.   So, while I give this hotel high marks in just about every category, the lack of good wifi may cause me to look elsewhere in the future. If that isn't a concern for you, however, this is a nice place to stay, and very conveniently located to downtown San Juan Capistrano.

Summary Heading: Basic amenities in a scenic location
Summary: This is our fourth stay at this hotel. We stay here when visiting family in San Juan Capistrano, it's a perfect place for coming and going. Its a very convenient location, about 10 minutes by car from Dana Point and the beach. There are nearby horse stables and horseback riding, a golf course, and a trail for running.   This is a very basic hotel, clean, spacious rooms, and a comfortable bed. There is also a refrigerator. Rooms on the second level have good size balconies.   This past stay we asked for a roll away bed, paid for it, and it was never delivered. We called the front desk and they were all out of roll aways. It was very disappointing, since we reserved it in advance. However, this was our first complaint after four stays.   Bring your own soap, the soap they provide
Manager Response: The Best Western Capistrano Inn values and appreciates your comments on your recent stay. We will always encourage and seek guest feedback. Overall Improvement in customer service is a focus for us and we continue to expect more from ourselves in order to exceed our guest expectations. Thank you for taking time out of your day to comment on your experience. Your business is appreciated and it would be our honor to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Rob Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661

Summary: This hotel was selected by the bride and groom for their wedding guests.  They were going for location and managing expense to their guests; they negotiated a rate.   Never received e-mail confirmation of the reservations and rate; requested twice after initial reservation. Verbally they confirmed the correct rates each time I called. When arrived, they could not figure what rooms to put us in (we needed 3 rooms, traveling with young children, they knew this when reservation was made), had no map of the facility, the front desk did not know what type of beds were in each room –then our rates were wrong, higher – they said I requested AAA, which I do not have.  They did not know the wedding rates and had to check other wedding guest rooms – the front desk said they would fix it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback to the Best Western Capistrano Inn. All staff and management will discuss customer reviews on a weekly basic. We are disappointed we could not provide the service we strive for and for not meeting your expectations. We will continue to strive for improvement and a better understanding of guest expectations. Feedback will be used to better serve our next guest and it is always encouraged and appreciated. Thank you for taking the time out of your day to comment on your experience. Our sincere apologizes for your inconvenience.  Sincerely,  Rob Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661

Summary Heading: What you expect from a BW off the freeway
Summary: This property was right off the 5. I pull in late one evening, the price was right, the room was clean and quite.  The fella at the front desk was awake and friendly at 1 AM.  What I like about Best Westerns is you know what your going to get.  Great place for a short stay while traveling in Southern California.  I would most likely stay again if passing through.
Manager Response: Thank you for the time you spend reviewing your experience at the Best Western Capistrano Inn. We appreciate all guest feedback and proactively use it to better serve our next guest. We value your business and are pleased to hear about your stay. It would be out honor to accommodate you and your needs in the future. We hope to see you again soon.  Rob Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661 Ext.450

Summary: I always consider Best Western when planning vacations, as I have good experience with their other hotels, but this particular one, though in great location to the places I planned to go, was not to my expectation. There were a lot of small roaches in our room, from the carpet to the beds. We check-in really late at the time when every motels/hotels are full so we had no choice but made do with the accommodation we have that moment. It was terrible. They should have someone to do quality check on their rooms and facilities. And this was our 5 year wedding anniversary vacation.
Manager Response: The Best Western Capistrano encourages guest’s reviews and appreciates all feedback. We genuinely embrace opportunities to rectify and resolve issues if a guest encounters one at our establishment. When we do not have this opportunity we are greatly disappointed. It would be my pleasure to rectify your experience if you would be kind enough to open a dialog with us directly.  Sincerely,  Robert Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661 Ext.450

Summary: Easy to find right off the highway. Parking is pretty tight. They're tucked in behind a busy gas station and right next to a Denny's. my room was on the south facing area and as I approached my room, there was a pungent oder of sewage. The room was nice with all the niceties. Nice tv with working remote. After getting some food at Denny's I decided to try out the jacuzzi, which was very nice ( so was the pool).  I had a good nights sleep. I was up at 6:30 am needing to get going, but wickedly disappointed to be told they had NO COFFEE till 7am. Grudgingly, I waited (gotta have my morning coffee).  The guy in the office for my check out was not hiding the fact that he couldn't have cared less.  I probably wouldn't stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate you saying something about your stay and experience at our hotel. I want to apologize for the lack of care you’re received during your check out. I am not pleased and I am highly disappointed about the absence of our sympathy regarding the coffee. We will continue to focus on improving guest service and we will take your comments to heart to better serve our next guest.   Thank you,  Robert Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn 949-493-5661

Summary: First we saw ants in the bathroom, there was a couple so we ignored it and said, no big deal in the bathroom.  We went out to music festival that we planned on going to and reason we stayed overnight, even though we were only about an hour and a half away from home was so we can make a weekend trip out of it.  So we went back to hotel after the festival, we were tired wanted to get some sleep.  We got into bed and then saw ants in our bed, that was gross!!!  We were disgusted because we thought if there are ants in the bed what other type of bugs may it have.  We called front desk and they did offer another room, but we were so grossed out that we said no way we would rather drive home and end our trip.  Which was a bummer and ruined our weekend trip.  It was nice of the hotel
Manager Response: I want to start my thanking you for taking the time out of your day to comment of your stay. We are disappointed we did not provide the accommodations and overall experience we strive for. We will take all guest feedback and use it for preventive purposes, ensuring issues like this from being repeated.   Robert Grether General Manager Best Western Capistrano Inn

Summary Heading: Will stay somewhere else next time
Summary: I can honestly say that I am disappointed with my experience at this hotel.  We often go to Best Westerns for the cleanliness and especially the full breakfast in the morning.  Well this stay had none of that.  Well, guess we are off to get some real breakfast.  Oh, the parking lot smells like raw sewage, and there is a half-way house in the next lot.  Beware!
Manager Response: We value your business and feedback at the Best Western Capistrano Inn. Our sincere apologizes for not meeting your expectations. The Best Western Capistrano Inn appreciates your time spent reviewing your stay. We are disappointed we could not provide a wonderful experience for you.

Summary: Stayed here on a brief overnight visit for a wedding. Very easy to find off the freeway. Our room was in the far corner of the property which meant it was very quiet. The bed was comfortable, shower was good, room pretty spacious. Breakfast was the usual Best Western unhealthy mix of sugary, fatty processed foods. And really, in California, in July, there are probably better fresh fruit choices than tired apples and bananas (which were gone by the time we got to breakfast). But we weren't there for the food. All in all, it was the least expensive of hotel choices for the event and it was just fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your valuable time to review your stay at the Best Western Capistrano Inn. We highly value and appreciate your business. Summary Heading: Good Hotel close to freeway for easy access
Summary: Stayed for 1 night with a car trailer. Front desk staff were so nice that they let me park my truck and car trailer right outside of reception under the canopy. Nice swimming pool and jacuzzi and clean basic rooms. Great location near freeway and downtown Capistrano

I normally love best westerns but this one is far from the best! Prepaid & reserved room on 1st floor 2 months in advance & then called right before to confirm they had first floor and was told they did no problem! Well when we got there they had the note on the reservation but no rooms left on ground floor! So we had to practically carry handicapped mother up to 2nd floor! Bed was like a slab of concreate! Breakfast in the morning was total crap! Frozen eggos instead of fresh made waffles only hard boiled eggs & a couple of other yucky things! Then we had to repack everything and move down stairs for the next day better beds but still angry about all the hassle! Manager won't be in untill Monday to complain to so don't know of they will do anything to make up for all the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your stay. Feedback will always be used for positive purposes. We are all disappointed to hear about your experience. Summary Heading: Just ok - don't you really want to stay in another town?
Summary: Given that there are only 2 hotels in San Juan Capistrano, and this one is rated higher than the other, don't you really want to go elsewhere?  This is an acceptable hotel for a stay. It's clearly an older building, with the typical front outside entrances, front windows, and air conditioners hanging in the fronts as well. The hotel has been trimmed up and painted extra-nicely, so it is attractive in appearance.   The front desk was cordial but not overly friendly. The room was clean and clearly in good repair, with flat-screen TV on the wall and fresh tile in the bathroom. The lighting was an odd combination of incandescent (!) lights in some fixtures and the newest technology LED can lights above the beds.   The beds were quite hard but reasonably comfortable if this mattress

Everything went smoothly with check in and outs. They have a shuttle that was available to my guests to the wedding venue or close area and everyone was thrilled about this. The rooms were clean and ready when everyone checked in. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The parking was convenient and easy. My guests all were very satisfied with the proximity to the Mission and walking distance to the local area places of train depot, shops, restaurants and bars. The breakfast buffet had lots of sweets, cereal, sweet rolls, frozen type waffles and yogurt so we had to wonder what all the salt and pepper was for.  The housekeeper was the only one who could get in our door consistently (she was very sweet about it too), the light was green but the door just wouldnt open unless she was doing it!, ha!, the people at the desk were cheerful and friendly upon check in and check out. Summary: Stay here, nice place with nice staff. A little pricey but not bad for the area. Dennys is next door and easy to walk to. Gas fill up there too. Right of the freeway. We will stay there again.

Summary Heading: I thought this place was perfectly nice.
Summary: The staff was friendly, the room was clean, there was free wifi, free parking, and free continental breakfast.  (And a free shuttle for local attractions, but it stops running at 10pm, just call the front desk 15 minutes before you need the shuttle).  There's an okay heated outdoor pool and hot tub.  I did go swimming in Feb, and there were a couple other brave guests also swimming.  I thought all in all everything was perfectly fine, so I would be happy to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in SJC
Summary: There aren't many lodging options in San Juan Capistrano, but this Best Western proved to be an excellent value anywhere.  Our room, with tax, came in at under $100 with our AAA discount, and you're literally two minutes away from Mission San Juan Capistrano. We arrived late, and the only problem we had here was finding parking.  The hotel was completely booked (and we hear that in season that is often the case), and cars were everywhere, including numerous spots (like where we had to park) that were not designated parking spaces.  Our room was great, though sprayed far too much with the cleaner/deodorizer which aggravated my wife's asthma (hotels should really lay off the chemicals - we've stayed places where we've had to air out the room for half an hour before we could go in

Summary Heading: adequate for one night...terrible breakfast selections for a Best Western
Summary: Stayed here for one night after a great dinner at the Vintage Steakhouse.  Rather than the long drive home, opted to stay overnight at this Best Western.  Room was nice, and although there was a very funky smell in the outside corridor, it didn't seem to get into the room.  Flat screen TV, and comfortable bed with nice pillows.  The refrigerator did not work (had to toss the leftovers...didn't want to risk it when I discovered the warm fridge in the morning), and didn't try the microwave, but the small coffee maker was welcome in the AM.  The "continental" breakfast was one of the worst we ever had at a Best Western.  There were only cold selections, and all the bread/rools were of the vending machine variety, and seemed old, to boot.  I sure missed the BW waffles!!  Even the

Summary Heading: Better than expected for the price
Summary: Stayed one night for a child's sporting event.  Exceeded my expectations considering the price and previous reviews.  It is certainly nothing fancy but was clean, comfortable mattress, no problems with the staff.  Pool was small but clean; small jacuzzi available.  Continental breakfast was better than expected as well - good coffee, yougurt, fresh fruit, frozen waffles, toast, cereal, instant oatmeal and hard boiled eggs.  Again, not bad for the price.  Walking distance to Denny's and within 2 blocks is a Marie Callendars and fast food.  About 5 blocks away was a wonderful equestrian trail - I had a nice morning walk...  Right off the highway.  One suggestion - request a room facing the pool - our friends were facing the street and had a lot of problem with the noise..

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights on business in December 2011. Everything was adequate although it's hardly new and shiny. Some of the electrical sockets were so loose you had to jiggle the plug around to get a contact, which is not good, but the TV, fridge, microwave, coffee percolator and room heater all worked fine. Bed was good and bedding clean. Some frat-boy whooping but that can't be blamed on the hotel. Far enough away from the interstate that traffic noise isn't a problem. Would stay here again --- it's about the only hotel in SJC, which is weird when you consider that SJC is supposed to be a tourist destination.

Summary Heading: I really enjoyed my 2 day stay
Summary: Room was very clean and the bed was wonderful.  Had refrig, micro, hair dryer, Ironing board, coffee maker.  It was a nice large room.  Pool area and motel grounds were clean.  We were going to stay one day and stayed two.  Would have stayed longer but the coastal weather was going to be rainy.  Staff was very helpful and courteous.  Room rate very reasonable for the coast.  I intend to go back.  The only thing I could say negative is the cleaning staff was noisy in the hallway with their conversations and everyone's luggage wheels are noisy on the tile hallway floor.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay at a reasonable price.
Summary: This hotel is a good place to stay if you need a room just for a place to crash for the night and aren't looking for fancy amenities.  A nice version of a Motel 6.   Not a resort by any means.  Rooms were pretty clean and updated.  The place is a little noisy, but I've been in worse. With the room heat/A-C unit running, you can get a good night's sleep.  Not really a place to sleep late.  Both evening and daytime staff were courteous and helpful.

Summary Heading: Pet friendly.  Good location.  Very average hotel.
Summary: The location of this place is great.  It's easy to find, right off the freeway.  It's about a mile away from the San Juan Capistrano Mission and the Los Rios district (the oldest neighborhood in California).  It's very close restaurants and a small park/equestrian center.  The hotel is also dog friendly (without an additional fee)!  Everything else is average.  The rooms are basic, plain and clean.  The connecting rooms worked out well for our group of friends.  Checking in and out was easy, but we didn't interact with the staff in between.  It was $108 total for a Saturday night in October.

My wife and I stayed here to attend a concert at the Coachhouse. The toilet barely flushed and the shower tub drain would back up after a short shower. The balcony sliding glass door curtain was tattered as was the shower curtain. $130.00 for these poor conditions was excessive! I would describe the place as a glorified Motel 6!

Summary: I recently stayed here for a friends wedding. Normally check in at most hotels is at 3pm, but they let me in at Noon. That was nice.  The room was clean and had basic amenities. It was near the freeway which is convenient, but I didn't hear any road noise. It was quiet. Overall a decent place to stay if you're trying to save a buck.

The grounds are nondescript--a pool and hot tub dominate the central area, surrounded by parking spaces--of which there were too few the Labor Day weekend we spent there.  In front there is an empty lot, the remants, perhaps, of a building in front of it which no longer stands.  Hardly scenic.  The rooms are generally quiet and dark. Summary Heading: Outdated rooms, extremely hard beds, great location and free shuttle
Summary: My husband and I recently stayed here for a friends wedding.  A majority of the wedding party all stayed here.  Our room was on the second floor, 205.  It was not updated and the beds were the hardest beds we've ever slept on in our entire lives.  The only way my husband and I were able to sleep was after having many alcoholic beverages.  The bed comforter had a cigarette burnt hole in it and was very outdated.  Upon arrival, I immediately inspected the bed for bedbugs after reading a recent report on bedbugregistry.org from March.  The good news was NO BEDBUGS, I was happy, but the mattress pad on the bed had not been washed in who knows how long, it was very gross.  I called the front desk and they did immediately sent the head housekeeper up to change it for us.  That was

Very pleasant staff; nice large room was clean and comfy.  My husband was happy about the nice flat screen TV and proximity to the golf course.  We would definitely stay there again.  This is a pet-friendly hotel, which was one reason we chose it.  The $25 one-time (not per night/pet) fee was a bargain compared to many hotels.  I was glad to note that there were no pet odors or stains from previous pet visitors.    The only cons:  The constant traffic noise from the nearby freeway detracted from enjoyment of the balcony.  (Not a problem in the room with door closed.)  Sometimes, it was difficult exiting the property onto a busy street near freeway ramps.

Summary Heading: Clean and Awesome - Friends needed room due to home flooding
Summary: I can't say enough about how awesome this hotel is. My friend's home was flooded just before Christmas and the hotel took them Inn and gave them, and those of us there to help, awesome room rates. The rooms were very clean and even smelled nice. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating.  While there, I met some senior citizens who were also staying there as their senior housing was flooded.   Thanks to this hotel, many people were not homeless over Christmas.

Summary Heading: The Worst Western, San Juan Capistrano
Summary: The Best Western San Juan Capistrano is the bottom of the barrel when it comes to Best Western Hotels. I've stayed at many Best Westerns in the past and this is by far the worst. Our room was not ready upon arrival at late check-in, it smelled, and we had to deal with constant noise from the ice machine or cleaning staff. Needless to say, we did our best to spend the least amount of time as possible at the hotel. Room for improvement? Yes... new parking arrangements, friendlier staff, and a overhaul of the rooms is highly recommended. We will not be returning to this hotel, nor will we use Priceline to book our hotel again.

Summary: Don't stay here!!!  I called to secure a crib for our stay and the staff said they had one.  When we got there I was told that they didn't have a crib and hadn't had one in months!  Since I was traveling with a 15 month old this presented a real problem.  The general manager told me it was my problem and he wouldn't refund my money so I could stay somewhere else.  To make our night even worse, it was VERY loud with people partying (again, the staff didn't care).  The rooms are shabby and all of the major lights are on a motion sensor so they don't stay on - they just keep flickering when you move around.

Summary: The door to our room would not lock and the telephone did not work. The rooms are shabby and noisy and the staff doesn't care.

We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions.We are currently under new management as of November 2011. Your feedback will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future. If I can be of any assistence to you please call.  Sincerely,  Robert Grether General Manager 949-493-5661 Ext.450

Summary Heading: This place is NOT for the weary traveler/business person/romantic getaway
Summary: Great place if you don't mind a bunch of noisy people and zero charm.... the rooms are mediocre... my room has a nice balcony - but my neighbor for the night is chain smoking (allowed on the adjoining balconies) and the smoke blows right in my room.  The front desk people are nice enough but one individual has the personality of a zombie and was completely clueless as to what a "rooming list" was for my party. Not much within walking distance but a Denny's... yay...... One member of my party had to change rooms as the room smelled like a "dead body". Lot's of noisy neighbors and loud talking people....    On a positive note - the owner/GM was VERY friendly and helpful. The pool was clean and the pool area was nice..... I would only recommend this place if it was an emergency and

Summary Heading: If you over paid and expected the Hilton...That's on you.
Summary: So you won't find a spa here but what you will find is a very friendly front desk staff, reasonably priced snacks and very unique/inexpensive souveniers in the lobby (and I have never purchased a souvenier in a hotel ever). The hotel is next to a few restaurants if you are not one of those people who only look to see what is around when you are entering the parking lot and that's it. The walls are a little thin and my daughter is telling me that the sheets aren't the best (she is 8 and just wanted to contribute to the story). Overall, I would stay here again and think that the people who are over-critical simply over paid and expected way too much for a moderatly priced hotel in a really nice town.

I stayed here for two nights with my wife and three kids. My mother-in-law was in an adjoining room. The hotel was clean and the rooms we were in showed evidence of a recent remodel. The bathrooms were really tiny. The small pool was clean and well maintained. The lack of any kind of breakfast cast doubt on the value of the hotel, in comparison with others. The biggest problem was the service. While the staff at check-in was helpful and efficient, the evening clerk was about the most clueless hotel worker we have encountered, unable to answer any question with more than "I need to speak to my manager." We ended up moving to another hotel for the final night.

If you want a peaceful stay...don't stay at this motel!  We booked a four night stay while visiting family in San Juan Capistrano.  This was the most miserable vacation I have ever had.  Don't count on getting any sleep, because the noise level is intollerable.  The rooms all have outside hallways, which are tiled.  The management takes no responsibility for disruptive guests and make no appologies.  This is rated #1 only because there are only two hotels in this town.  It is totally worth the drive to stay in San Clemente, which is the next exit!!

Location GREAT!  Setting Picture perfect.   Problem #1  35 minute wait for someone to answer front door for check-in.  Sign in window read "Will be right back." No one answered the local phone for this property.  After waiting 15 minutes, tried to contact Best Western reservation number.  No one from Best Western main office could locate anyone on the property to help.   Problem #2  Once check in employee arrived (in company van) he stated that he was only one to drive.  Assigned room 408, opened door to find room occupied.  Reassigned second room - no apology - no offer of any reduction - EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER CARE!!!!!!

Decent hotel: clean, with microwave and fridge. Noisy but I always travel with ear plugs. The hotel is behind a gas station so the driveway entrance is actually in front of the "Capistrano Inn" sign. The gas station is at a major intersection right off the freeway. Because the driveway is shared with the gas station, during rush hour a lot of cars pulling out of the gas station will be blocking the entrance because they are angled to align with main road traffic flow.

We selected the Capistrano Inn for its location, and were happy with our choice.   The room was large, light, and clean with a refrigerator, microwave, separate sink area, and balcony.  Much nicer than usual for this type of place.  We had no trouble with noise, but then we left the fan or air conditioner on througout.  Maid service was a little lax.  We left the "Please make this room up" sign on the door, and when we came back at four o'clock, I had to hunt out the maid to get her to take care of the room.  The "free" breakfast is a coupon for $2.99 off at Denny's.  If this doesn't ring your bell, you can pick up something at a nearby bakery or try one of the excellent retaurants in the area.  Our favorite is the Ramos House in the historical section.  Breakfast is pricey, but

If the room conditions were not bad enough, we dealt with mishaps and bad customer service.  When we checked in we went to our room and found than,they had given us keys to a room that was already occupied! After our stay we discovered we forgot an item in the room and called to see if they could mail it to us.  They said yes and hung up, but never asked for our address, phone number or anything.  I called on various occasions to inquire about the shipping status and was constantly thrown out of the line or the phone never answered. When I spoke to anyone they seemed in a hurry to get you off the phone.  After a week of this back and forth I'm still waiting for the item to arrive. My adivse, don't leave anything behind!

Summary Heading: too expensive for what you get
Summary: Well, room was very spacious and clean. But walls are very thin, you can hear everything from your neighbours. Breakfast: at check-in they tell you free breakfast, but in the morning they just gave us coupons (2.99 each) for Danny's nearby.

Summary Heading: a good deal for what you get
Summary: Stayed here for an anniversary weekend a couple of weeks back-- the location is excellent if Old San Juan is a primary destination on your itinerary.  Check in was a little strange; it seemed someone was getting trained that evening and, instead of explaining this and perhaps offering a quick apology and a "please be patient" we just stood there for a long time while the new guy figured things out with the veteran guy watching.  It was late (close to midnight) and we were tired, so we thought that was a bit odd.  The room was fine, the carpets a little "sticky" however, and it was pretty loud all through the night (very thin walls).  Half way through the weekend, our key just stopped working for no apparent reason, but they remedied that pretty quickly.  All in all, a good deal

My Fiance and I traveled to San Juan Capistrano on Labor Day Weekend for a wedding.  The hotel was in a great location, however, it was pretty low budget.  The lobby is a small 1/2 room 1/2 sitting area 1/2 cooler filled with beverages for purchase.    Check in was quick and easy- our room was ready long before the "normal check-in time" of 3 pm (i think we checked in around noon)  The hotel is the kind that you drive to your room door and park there (didn't they used to call those "motor lodges"?) We drove to our room (2nd floor) and got settled.    The room: -smelled like cheap deodorizer (we had to air it out immediately) -had a small balcony..looking at nothing -had a microwave and refridgerator -separate sink area - outside of the toilet and shower area  the good: -location

Fantastic small hotel close to the old historic San Juan Capistrano 5 minute walk. Also close to the freeway to San Diego and Los Angeles. The rates were terrific and that included coupons for breakfast at the Denny's next door. The staff was very friendly and attentative. I would highly recommend staying here to visit southern Orange County and for day trips to Disneyland and to San Diego. This is our 2nd time we stayed at the property and we stayed for 6 nights on this trip.

This is a decent no frills motel.  They tell you that it's 3 blocks from Old Town San Juan Capistrano which is true.  However, you have to cross the freeway to get to the Old Town.  This is possible on foot, but not very pleasant.  They need new mattresses.  I don't consider myself a terrible hotel snob, but that was the most uncomfortable bed that I can remember ever sleeping in.  I would have been perfectly content with the room otherwise.

Summary Heading: Price is right for the location!
Summary: Rooms were clean and quiet but a little dated. They are doing some remodeling as the looks of it. Price was fair when you booked on line instead of calling the hotel it self. Staff was not very informative as we weren't told about the cont. breakfast that was served. For the price and location we would stay again.

My room was at the back of the hotel.  Hard to park, construction type vehicles and personel seemed to be staying there long term.  My room smelled very sour, my feet stuck to the carpet, dining table was very, very sticky, blanket well-worn and very wrinkled, and the pillows were worn-out and lumpy.  If that was not enough, my room had an electrical problem the second day-knocking out one whole side of the room including TV.  We were moved to a room up front, the difference was extreme: outstanding pillows and newer pillows and covers.  We had to move all our own stuff for the last night.  No one even offered to assist.   My room at the local Travel Lodge was much better but it had a lot more traffic noise.

Summary Heading: A Nice Place To Stay in SJC
Summary: We stayed overnight at the Best Western San Juan Capistrano and had a great experience. A wonderful value, clean rooms and convenient location, right off I-5 at Ortega Highway. The hotel is well set back from the street, so there was no traffic noise at all. Getting back out of the hotel's driveway onto Ortega Highway can be a little bit tricky during busy times. Watch out for other cars leaving the adjacent Union 76 gas station as you pull out onto the road.   Denny's restaurant is located right next door to the hotel and provides an easy place to grab a quick bite to eat without having to drive anywhere, but other local restaurants and the Mission are only a few blocks away.   Our second floor room had very comfortable beds, and featured a mini fridge, microwave and coffee

I feel like I owe this establishment a good review after experiencing a very pleasent weekend there. My wife and I were in town for a wedding over Memorial day weekend. This hotel is one of only two choices actually in SJC and since were are arriving by train we had to stay someplace close. I was a bit nervous after reading all of the negative reviews on this sight, but thought, "What the heck. Lets see if thier right". Well I wound up being pleasently suprised. We were picked up at the trian station by their shuttle which was more than I expected. Being without a car, we wound up using the shuttle extensively. They will take you just about any where close by for no charge (we tipped of course and you should too). We even went to the Mission Viejo mall which is about 5 miles

Wow, my experience at this hotel was much different than some of the other experiences posted here. (Come on people, if guests get drunk and decide to assault each other, is the hotel at fault? Sadly, it's not unheard of ... I've stayed at more than a few motels & hotels where vacationers seemed to put their morals and values "on holiday".) I stayed here on a Sunday night, which was quiet, and found the room quite spacious and quiet as well -- I did stay in a room toward the back of the property, not one of the westernmost rooms closer to the freeway.  Didn't hear freeway noise. I thought it was a good value for the money -- South Orange County is so high-end that even the mid-priced chains are going to charge above-average prices, and the Doubletrees and Hiltons will be through
Spent one night after a wedding in SJC.  They charged me 3 nights.....said they let my son for free.  I don't have a son.  The manager was rude.  Room was ok.
The hotel was unimpressive.  The worst part was the noise of drunken teenagers running up and down the halls at around 2:30 AM.

Please do not stay at this hotel. The previous review was right on - a roadside motel. On top of that there was a fist fight right in front of my door at 3 am by two very drunken guests. The hotel did not take action until all the guests started srcreaming and everyone got involved in the fight and the police finally came. The hotel did not give me any refund despite the fact that this was in front of my door and was not able to sleep all night. Please stay somewhere else.

This place is essentially a roadside motel where a weary traveler might rest his head for a night.  It is not a place for weekend getaway to San Jaun Capistrano, as I unfortunately made the mistake of doing.    What made things worse was the $135 price tag.  I have no problem spending money on hotels but this place should be priced around $70.  Take my advise, spend a little more $ and stay somewhere else.  You will be much happier.

This place was perfect for my daughter, myself and our small dog. We never heard any dogs crying or whining or had to deal with hearing every move our neighbors made in the restroom or shower! It was close to everything you could possibly need, food, grocery stores, and so on.   The only advice I'd give to the Best Western is to provide a place where you can take the dogs to potty and provide doggie waste bags.  There was only one patch of dirt and it was highly used and the smell at this spot was not pleasant even for the dog!  Otherwise, I definiely would stay again we felt safe too!  I paid a whole lot more at the DBL Tree in Dana Point and we did not get one good nights rest!  I would request this place to all horse show people coming into towne at the Oaks!

Construction going on across from parking lot at 0800, so don't plan on sleeping in.  Room needed some TLC and better housekeeping.  Used dental floss device left next to bed, YUK!  Sad excuse for a "continental breakfast", reminded me of boxed lunches in high school.  My advise to you would be to drive a few extra miles and stay in Dana Point or San Clemente.

Very nice place, clean spacious rooms, the grounds are very well maintained. The pool area was lovely. The hotel is located a short drive or about a 5 minute walk from the historic part of San Juan Capistrano. Never used the free shuttle we had our own car. The breakfast was at Denny's next door Stayed 4 nights would stay again.
I stayed there for 2 weeks and it was very clean, landscaped and had a happy and helpful staff.

Very relaxed and calm atmosphere. I arrived at the hotel with my three  children under 7 years of age. My husband met me there after he got off  work.      When we got there, customer service could of been friendlier. I asked for help with my luggage and they said there was no one to help and if I could just wait until my husband got there.     I also think they should of explained everything they offered when I checked in. I found out on my own about their laundry room, complimentary laundry soap, courtesy van, and continental breakfast.       The room was basic, but with plenty of cupboards for our clothes. It had a coffee maker, iron, and radio. It was very clean which was a plus for us. The rug did need changing.       The pool area had flowers around it with lounge
